Rodinson es un hombre de 48 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo Robinson inicio sus estudios de Administración de Empresas, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos tuvo que suspenderlos, pero le gustaría poder retomarlos, en sus ratos libres le gusta compartir gratos momentos con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Rodinson trabaja en su pequeño negocio de transporte urbano, el cuenta con dos autos, el cual uno de ellos alquila a otros choferes y el otro lo maneja él brindando servicios de transporte, Rodinson trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas.
Rodinson se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la refacción y el mantenimiento general que necesita su vehículo, de esta manera podrá seguir brindando sus servicios y generará ingresos para su familia, así pues Rodinson seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Rodinson is a 48 years old man. He lives in the city of Pucallpa with his wife and four children. He loves them and they are the main reason for living. He is a very friendly person, hardworking and enthusiastic, and he and his wife put forth all their efforts into bringing up the family.

Rodinson though his own efforts began his Business Administration studies, but unfortunately due to financial reasons had to stop, but he would like to start back again. In his free time he likes to share great moments with his family.

Through his own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Rodinson works in his own small business of urban transport and he has two cars. One of them he rents to other drivers and he drives the other offering transportation services. Rodinson works every day from the early morning hours and does so for about ten hours.

Rodinson is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as thanks to the provided help he can make repairs and do the necessary general maintenance to his car so he can continue offering his services and earn income for his family. So Rodinson will continue working and striving to achieve his big dream of seeing his children become good professionals.

loans.use: to pay for repairs and general maintenance of his vehicle which he uses in his transport business

loans.name: Melissa Ysabel

texts.es:
Melissa es una mujer de 20 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Melissa se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Bioquímica que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación Melissa trabaja vendiendo productos naturales, como batidos, vitaminas y otros, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 6 horas, Melissa se siente a gusto trabajando y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Melissa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad de productos naturales para su venta, de esta manera Melissa tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y atenderá a más clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en una buena profesional.
texts.en:
20 year old Melissa is single and lives with her parents and siblings in the city of Ica in the district of Parcona. She is a very likeable, hard-working and enthusiastic person, with a strong drive to improve herself. Thanks to her hard work and her parents' support, Melissa is currently studying for a professional career as a biochemist, which she has always wanted to do. In her spare time she likes to listen to music and sometimes makes a very tasty 'Arroz con Pollo' [a traditional chicken and rice dish] to share with the family. 

Acting on her own initiative and with great dedication, Melissa sells natural products such as milkshakes, vitamins and other items. She works every day from early in the morning and can work for around 6 hours. She enjoys her work and thinks it is going well because her prices are good and she treats her customers well. Melissa is very grateful to the lenders since she will be able to buy more products wholesale with the support she is getting. By doing this she will have a better-stocked business and will be able to serve more customers. In this way she will be able to carry on working hard to realise her big dream of becoming a true professional.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Gloria Del Rocio

texts.es:
La Señora. Gloria forma parte del grupo de crédito Las Flores desde hace 3 años, en este tiempo ha establecido muy buenos lasos de amistad con todas sus amigas, le gusta mucho el compañerismo, la solidaridad y el compromiso que tienen todos para salir adelante, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de un clima frió y esta bañada por 4 ríos, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad por la belleza de su centro histórico, su gente aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Gloria tiene 34 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijas de 17, 15, 12,10 años y su última hija de apenas 3 meses de edad, sus tres primeras hijas están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad y su penúltima hija esta estudiado en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión electricista, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

Doña Gloria trabaja todos los días como auxiliar de limpieza desde hace dos años y labora de lunes a viernes, en el tiempo de clases da servicio privado de transporte escolar a varios niños. 

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de repuestos para el arreglo de su vehículo. 

Su meta es comprarse una casa.
texts.en:
Gloria has been a part of the Las Flores credit group for three years.  In this time, she has established very good ties of friendship with all her friends.  She likes the friendship, solidarity, and the agreement that everyone has to succeed.  She lives in the city Cuenca, which has a cold climate and is surrounded by four rivers.  In December 1999, it was made a World Heritage Site for the beauty of its historic center.  The people still maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors.  

Gloria is 34 years old, married, and has five daughters who are 17, 15, 12, and 10 years old, and her youngest is just 3 months old.  Her three oldest daughters are studying at a school in the city and her second to last daughter is studying at a primary school in the city.  Her husband is an electrician.  They do not own a house, so they rent.

Gloria has worked every day as a cleaning assistant for two years and works Monday to Friday. During the school year, she provides a private school transportation service for various children.  She will use this loan to purchase parts to repair her vehicle.  

Her goal is to purchase a house.

loans.use: to purchase parts for her vehicle.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 41-year-old Salamatu from the Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 6 months and 15 years. Two of her children are attending school. She started this business because she dropped out of school at an early age and decided to run a business because she doesn’t want to be idle.  

Salamatu runs a provision shop; she sells milk, sugar, ovaltine, mayonnaise and drinks. She has been running this business since 2005. She works at the business seven days a week for twelve hours a day.  Salamatu says that the main challenge in her business is that transporting her goods from the city to her business place is very difficult.

Salamatu has requested a loan in order to purchase milk, sugar, ovaltine, mayonnaise and drinks for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to buy a plot of land and renovate her house. In the future, she plans to open a big provision shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, ovaltine, mayonnaise, drinks, and other items for resale.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is a 24-year-old man who lives in the outskirts of a main town. He is married and has one child. Gerald is a businessman who operates a bar business. He also supplements his income with saloon and video library businesses. He started his bar business in 2011 and his aim was to generate income for sustaining his family. He sells his products to residents around his area.

His hopes are to expand his bar to a modern set up and allocate other branches in rural setting. He says he intends to use the loan acquired to buy more stock for his bar so as to attract more clients, who keep asking for more varieties of spirits that are new on market, but which he does not have.

His main challenge is lack of enough capital and refusal of clients to pay after getting drunk. He describes himself as a hard-working man and asks Ugafode to continue rendering their services to the local people.

loans.use: to buy beverages to sell.

loans.name: Saulo

texts.en:
Saulo is a youthful man of about 29 years living in Buyamba local area. He has a family of 3 kids that he looks after. He ventures in banana farming, a business he has done for the last 4 years. He couples it with motorcycle taxi riding for a daily income activity. He says he started boda boda to supplement the earnings from his plantation, that usually gives earnings after 2 weeks.

He says he managed to acquire the motorcycle through Ugafode asset acquisition loan, which has increased his incomes. He has also managed to buy a cow that has given him some milk to improve his household diet.

Recemtly he has managed to assemble some bricks which he hopes to use to put up a semi-permanent house to improve his household living. He hopes to use the facility extended to him to mulch his plantation, especially as it’s currently a dry spell, to avoid loss of soil water affecting his yields. He confesses a major challenge of destructive rains when they struck, destroying big chunks of the plantation, and the banana bacterial wilt.

loans.use: to buy mulches.

loans.name: Las Estrellas De Xenacoj Group

texts.en:
Las Estrellas de Xenacoj (the Stars of Xenacoj) Trust Bank consists of eight women from Santo Domingo Xenacoj Guatemala. The women are on average 36 years old, and they are engaged in a range of activities such as: purchasing and selling traditional clothing, growing and selling agricultural products, selling snacks, and weaving Guatemalan textiles. Out of the eight women in the group, six never received any formal education, and only two have finished high school.

One of the farmers among the group is Anselma who is 34 years old and has four children (three boys and a girl). Although Anselma never went to school, she is a hard worker and has a strong desire to succeed and build a better future for her children. She and her husband have been farmers for several years, and currently cultivate 10 acres of land. 

Anselma is requesting a new loan from Friendship Bridge in order to obtain additional working capital in maintain their land. They will use this loan to buy seed in order to plant green beans and to purchase fertilizers. Their farm has been so successful that they have hired three full-time employees. Anselma and her husband make product deliveries to an export company every two days, so employing help ensures that the farm maintains high levels of productivity and efficiency. This dedication to quality products continues to generate a steady income for the family.

"I am very anxious to receive this new loan to continue cultivating green beans.  Our business feeds us, and also helps us to provide education to our children.  I am happy because one of my children is starting middle school and the other one is in sixth grade. My husband and I appreciate the support we have received so far, and I hope to continue (with Friendship Bridge and KIVA) for a long while," explains Anselma.

loans.use: To buy seeds to plant green beans and to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Alex Adilio

texts.es: Don Alex tiene 35 años  vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo de 15 años de edad quien estudia actualmente,  él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace 5, sus cultivos los comercializa en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia  con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, don Alex  está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc.  Para seguir con su siembra y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alex is 35 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and 14 year old son who is currently studying.

He has been working growing corn and beans for five years. He sells his crops at the various markets that are close to where he lives. He uses the profits to cover some of the household expenses.

Alex is asking for a loan in order to buy fertilizers, compost, seeds, herbicides, etc. so that he can continue farming and providing his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, seeds, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Ventanilla Alta Group

texts.es:
Esta es la alcancía Mujeres Emprendedoras De ventanilla Alta
Una de las socias es María Margarita de 54 años ella es separada y tiene 06 hijos mayores de edad. María Margarita trabaja para ayudar al menor de sus hijos de 16 años, sus amigas  la animaron a dedicarse a la venta de productos de belleza, ella ofrece sus  productos a sus amistades, vecinos y personas ocasionales ya tiene un año vendiendo y le va muy bien, por otro lado también prepara dulces para vender; con el préstamo  solicitado podrá comprar más productos de belleza como perfumes, cremas y maquillaje para ofrecer a sus clientas. María Margarita está contenta con su grupo y más adelante le gustaría tener un lugar para poner su negocio y no tener que salir a las calles a buscar clientes ya que es muy riesgoso.
En la foto es la tercera de la izquierda, viste casaca color morada.
texts.en:
This is the communal bank Mujeres Emprendedoras De Ventanilla Alta [Women entrepreneurs of Ventanilla Alta]

One of the members is María Margarita who is 54 years old and has 6 adult children. She works to support the youngest of her children who is 16. Her friends encouraged her to set up in business selling beauty products and she sells to her friends, neighbours and occasionally other people. She has been selling for a year now and it is going well. She also makes sweets to sell.

She will use the loan to buy more beauty products such as perfumes, creams and make-up to offer her customers. María Margarita is happy in the group and in the future she would like to have a place where she can run her business so that she doesn't have to go out in the streets looking for customers, since it is very risky.

In the photograph she is the third from the left, in the purple jacket.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Danika Marina

texts.es:
Danika es una mujer de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su esposo y pequeño hijo, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tiene de trabajar, Danika no ha podido estudiar la carrera técnica de Repostería, pero gracias a las enseñanzas de su madre ha podido aprender a preparar deliciosos postres y pasteles, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar alguna comida especial para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Danika trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de pasteles y tortas, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, Danika realiza sus ventas en su hogar y también sale a recorrer las calles para vender sus tortas.
Danika se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea cubrir los gastos para la construcción de una habitación con materiales adecuado y resistentes, de esta manera Danika brindará mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a su hijo convertido en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Danika is 21 years old and lives with her husband and little son, who she loves and are the centre of her life, in the city of Cañete in the district of Imperial. She is a very likeable, hard-working and enthusiastic person who works very hard with her husband to move her family forward. Unfortunately due to lack of finances and needing to work, Danika has not been able to study a technical course in confectionery but has learnt from her mother how to make delicious desserts and pastries. In her spare time she enjoys making a special meal to share with her family. 

Acting on her own initiative and with great dedication, Danika works in her small business selling pastries and cakes. She works every day from early in the morning for around 8 hours. She sells her products from home and also goes around the streets selling her cakes. 

Danika is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since she will be able to make improvements to her home with the support she is getting. She needs to cover the costs of building a room with suitable durable materials so that she can improve her family's security and wellbeing. After this she will carry on working hard to achieve her biggest dream of seeing her son become a professional.

loans.use: to improve her home.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 38 years old. She is married with 7 children aged between 4 and 19, who all go to school. She is a rice farmer and has been a rice farmer for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Utatlan Group

texts.en:
In the northwestern highlands of Guatemala is the department (state) of Santa Cruz del Quiche. This is one of the most important departments in terms of craft production. Here you will find women weaving and crafting embroidery on backstrap looms. 

Last year, a new Friendship Bridge Trust Bank was formed called Utatlan, and it is composed of 11 female entrepreneurs who own a variety of commerce businesses that range from textiles and clothing to medicine and cosmetics. Continued funding is pivotal for these women to obtain the financial capital needed to support and grow their businesses.  In addition, when receiving a microloan from Friendship Bridge, they also receive monthly educational lessons.

The current secretary of the Utatlan Trust Bank is Angelica. Angelica is 34 years old and married to a bricklayer assistant. Together they have four children, two of whom are currently enrolled in school. Angelica’s business is selling traditional and used clothing, which she sells door to door as well as from her home. Angelica’s business is doing well, thus she has decided to invest more capital into the business. 

Angelica successfully paid off her first loan and has now applied for a second loan. She is requesting a loan of approximately $320, which she will use to purchase additional merchandise in order to offer a greater variety of products to her customers. Her hope is that in the future she will be able to create a second business. To reach that goal she must grow her revenue from her commerce business and start saving. Her savings combined with Friendship Bridge microloans will help get her second business up and running.

She and her colleagues are very excited to be able to have access to funding they would not have without Kiva and Friendship Bridge. The women in the Utatlan Trust Bank enjoy the monthly educational lessons, which are an integral part of the Friendship Bridge model, where the women in the Trust Bank discuss topics related to business administration, budget, promotion, and different ways of do business (wholesale, retail, catalog, personal sales, etc.).

Angelica personally wants to thank Kiva investors for offering her access to financial capital, for their generosity, which has enabled her and her teammates to continue to grow their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise.

location.town: Santa Cruz del Quiche, El Quiche

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 43 years old. He is married with three children. He has been a rice farmer for 10 years. With the loan, he would like to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production. He is planning to use the profits to buy a cow to provide milk for the family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 40 years old. He is married with five children. He has been a rice farmer for the past 20 years. With the loan, he would like to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production. The profits from rice production will be used to light in his house by installing electricity in the house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 48 years old. He is married with seven children.  He has been a rice farmer for the past ten years. With the loan, he would like to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production. He plans to use the profits for buying animals for rearing at home which will earn returns in the future.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers. 

Fatuma is 41 years old.  She is a mother of four children and they all attend schools. With the loan, she would like to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production. She would like to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Damien

texts.en:
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers. 

Damien is 51 years old. He is a father of eight children. With the loan, he would like to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Fulamusu

texts.en:
Meet Fulamusu, She is a 30-year-old woman from Waterloo eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is married and has three children. Two of her children are currently attending school. 

In 2005, Fulamusu established a local food business within the Waterloo community. She began her business because she wanted to create a permanent source of income to support her children. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation of goods.

Fulamusu requires a loan in order to purchase more local food like palm oil, gari and beans. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to become more successful and pay her children's school fees. 

In the future, Fulamusu plans to expand her enterprise to wholesale. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more local food like palm oil, gari and beans.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 39 years old and has two children, ages 7 years and 20 years. Her children are going to school.

She runs a clothing enterprise in Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown.  She began this business because she was a housewife and she wanted to stop sitting at home. Instead she wants earn her own income. 

She's been in this business for 12 years and sells jeans, T-shirts and underwear.  She says that, despite the challenges, she is a very hardworking woman and desires to educate her children.

Fatima requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase jeans, T-shirts and underwear. She says that the extra resulting income will help her to increase her business and improve their standard of living. 

In the future, she would like to build her own shop and expand her business more than ever. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase jeans, T-shirts and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers. 

Emmanuel is 24. He is single and has spent five years in rice farming. With the loan, he would like to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production. He plans to use the profits for buying a machine that will help him to cultivate a big area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers. 

Celestine is 53 years old. He has been in the farming business for the past 15 years. With the loan, he would like to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production. He plans to use the profits by reinvesting in the rice farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Keo's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Pursat province’s Kror Kor district, Keo is 61 years old and married. She has one son who is still in school. 

To make a living and support her family, Keo and her husband have been farming rice as the primary business for ten years. The current business earns her about 13,000 KHR per day to support her family.

This is the first micro loan for Keo with VisionFund. Now leading her group to request a loan, Keo will use her portion to renovate her old house. She hopes to have a decent house for her family to live in.

loans.use: To renovate her old house.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Meet 25-year-old Zainab from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children.  She began her business because she wanted create her own source of income.  In 2000, Zainab established her small business.  She works at the business from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm, Monday to Friday. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Zainab requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, Pure Water, soft drinks, and milk. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to expand her business and buy a piece of land. In the future, Zainab plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, Pure Water, soft drinks, and milk

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Srey is aged 42 years and married. She has five children, three of whom are dependents and still in school. To support the family, she and her husband have been in farming rice for 12 years. The current business earns her family about 35,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.

Srey is just with VisionFund this cycle and now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials for construction a decent latrine. She hopes this loan will enable her to get a clean latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: to buy materials for construction of a decent latrine.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 35 years old and married with four children. She runs a palm oil business in Waterloo Western, a rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to make a living. 

She's been in this business since 2010 and sells palm oil within a busy market area. She says that at present, her business is doing well because she was able to take care of her family with the profits.

Hawa requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more palm oil for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and renovate her house. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Chrey's Group

texts.en:
Chrey is aged 60 years and married. She has eight children living in a rural village of Pursat province’s Bakan district. 

She and her husband earn a living through farming rice, which they have been doing for 33 years. The current business earns them about 39,000 KHR per day and enables them to save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Chrey has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Chrey is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and gasoline for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice successfully and increase her current business to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and gasoline for her farmland.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 49-year-old Florence from Kandeh town Bo. She is married with seven children between the ages of 8 years and 31 years. Three of her children are currently attending school. 

Florence runs a food stand; she sells rice, peppers and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business for 16 years. She works at the business throughout the week and 10 hours per day.  Florence says that sometimes business is very difficult.

Florence has requested a loan in order to purchase cooking seasonings, rice and oil for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and expand her business. In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise even more. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cooking seasonings, rice and oil for resale.

loans.name: Eseza

texts.en:
Eseza is a 39-year-old lady applying for a third loan from UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd (MDI). She a married woman with three children that go to school with the help of her husband and the income she earns from her maiz- roasting business. From this business and the previous loan advanced to her, she has managed to pay fees for their first-born at university and also acquire a small piece of land that she plans to develop in the future.

The purpose of the loan is to start developing her piece of land and also pay the remaining tuition fees for her son at university. Her future plan is constructing rental houses that will help her generate more income in the future and also continue contributing to her children’s education.

loans.use: to start developing a piece of land.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Chantha is a 33-year-old married mother of three children who are dependent on her and still in school. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for 10 years and to better support the family and help to earn more income, her husband catches fish. Together, they can earn about 17,000 KHR per day to meet family’s needs and manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Chantha has been with VisionFund for one cycle. The first loan helped Chantha better support her family members. Now she is leading her group to apply for a new loan. Chantha wants to use her portion to buy fishing materials for her husband’s business. She hopes he can catch more fish so as to make a living better and keep their children in school.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials for her husband’s business

loans.name: Humu

texts.en:
Meet 25-year-old Humu from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with one child aged 4 years.  She began her business because she wanted to create her own source of income, instead depending on her husband alone.  In 2005, Humu established her general store business.  She works at the business from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm, Monday to Friday. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Humu requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, Pure Water, soft drinks and milk. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and start a savings account. In the future, Humu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, Pure Water, soft drinks and milk.

loans.name: Las Rosas De Xenacoj Group

texts.en:
Many women in the Guatemalan highlands are dedicated to the production of textiles, and such is the case for the women from Santo Domingo Xenacoj.  Seven months ago the Las Rosas de Xenacoj (Xenacoj Roses) Trust Bank was formed. This new Trust Bank consists of eight women, who are on average 33 years old. Their businesses focus on the production of typical clothing and housewares like blouses, fajas (sashes), and tablecloths.  After seven months, all of the members of the Las Rosas de Xenacoj Trust Bank have successfully repaid their first loans and have now applied for a second loan cycle.  In addition, two new members have been voted into the Trust Bank.

Dolores, a new member of the Las Rosas de Xenacoj Trust Bank, is 28 years old and married to a tailor.  They are a new family as they just welcomed their first daughter into the world last year.  Dolores makes fajas (sashes) in various colors and designs. She is known in the community for having beautiful designs and colors that all of her clients thoroughly enjoy. At this point, her business is doing quite well, so she approached Friendship Bridge to request her first loan of approximately US $256. She will use these funds to buy a variety of colors of thread that she will use in order to keep up with the current demand for her garments. 

Dolores is very excited about the loan, as she has clients who regularly purchase from her.   This means steady income for her and her family. As a young family, Dolores and her husband know that husbands and wives must work to support each other in order to provide the best life for their children.  Dolores has a dream to own a storefront where she can showcase her products and gain more clients without neglecting her regular customers who continue to support her and purchase her products.  Dolores has confidence and a business plan to do this and part of the plan relies on capital from Friendship Bridge. 

The rest of the women in the Las Rosas de Xenacoj Trust Bank are grateful for the support of Friendship Bridge and KIVA investors. By endowing their Trust Bank with funding the women are already supporting the development of their families and their community.

loans.use: To buy a variety of colors of thread.

loans.name: Ana Delmi

texts.es: Ana de 40 años de edad  vive casa propia con su esposo y  sus cuatro hijos ellos estudian actualmente, ella tiene  una  tienda en la cual vende productos de primera  necesidad  como cereales, golosinas,  bebidas, aceites  entre otros , por su gran dedicación ella ha logrado tener una buena clientela  a la cual ella trata de ofrecer los mejores precios y productos, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Ana está solicitando un crédito para poder  realizar la compra de  productos por mayor como golosinas, aceite, granos básicos, huevos, refrescos, agua embotellada,etc. lo que le permitiría  acrecentar  y mejorar sus ganancias y de esa manera poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Forty-year-old Ana lives in her own house with her husband and four children, who are currently in school.  Ana has a shop where she sells basic items such as cereals, sweets, drinks, oil and more.  Thanks to her dedication, Ana has managed to develop a strong customer base.  Ana tries to offer the best prices and products and, with her profits, she is able to cover some household costs.  Ana is applying for a loan in order to buy products, such as sweets, basic grains, eggs, fizzy drinks and bottled water, in bulk.  This will allow Ana to increase her profits and she will thus be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy products, such as sweets, basic grains, eggs, fizzy drinks and bottled water, in bulk.

loans.name: Nancy Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora. Nancy desde hace 6 años forma parte del grupo de crédito Las Flores, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de un clima frió y esta bañada por 4 ríos,  es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad por la belleza de su centro histórico, su gente aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. La banca comunal le gusta por la unión y compañerismo de todas las socias.

La Señora Nancy tiene 47 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos, su primera hija ya es casada, su segundo hijo es especial y su última hija trabaja y estudian en la universidad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y presta sus servicios en una empresa pública, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña Nancy se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar ya que no puede dejarle solo a su hijo, pero para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la preparación de viandas y trabaja de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres y vajilla para su negocio.

Su sueño es no tener deudas.
texts.en:
Nancy has been a member of the communal bank Las Flores for 6 years. She lives in the city of Cuenca. This city has a cool climate and is bathed by 4 rivers. It has been a World Heritage Site since 1999 because of the beauty of its historic center. Its people still retain the culture and traditions of their people. She likes the communal bank because of the bonding and fellowship of all the members. 

Nancy is 47 years old, married and has 3 children. Her oldest daughter is married, her second son is a special child, and her youngest child works and studies at university. Her husband is by profession a driver and works for a public company. They live in their own home.

Nancy is a housewife as she cannot leave her son alone, but in order to help her husband with the household expenses she prepares dishes and works from Monday through Friday without a set schedule.

She is going to use the loan to buy groceries and tableware for her business. Her dream is to be debt free.

loans.use: to buy groceries and tableware for her business

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers. 

Solange is 51 years old. She is a mother of six children between 19 and 27. With the loan, she would like to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production. She plans to use the profits for reinvesting in the same farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: María Martha

texts.es:
La Señora. María se encuentra en el grupo de crédito Las Flores desde  hace 8 años, tiempo en el que ha llegado a tener una mejor amistad y compañerismo con todas las integrantes, los crédito le han permitido mejorar la estabilidad económica de su hogar. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de un clima frió y esta bañada por 4 ríos, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad por la belleza de su centro histórico, su gente aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora María tiene 48 años, es madre soltera de un hijo de 20 años que está estudiando en la universidad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar. 

Doña María tiene una tienda de víveres en la cual trabaja desde hace 6 años, labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, como tiene este negocio aprovecha también para ofrecerles a sus clientes comida rápida. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en víveres para su tienda. 

Su sueño es no tener deudas.
texts.en:
María has been part of the "Las Flores" group for eight months, during which time she has developed friendships and partnerships with all members of the group.  Loans have allowed each member of the group to improve financial stability in their homes.  María lives in the city of Cuenca, a place with a cold climate, and surrounded by four rivers.  Cuenca has been a UNESCO World Heritage Site, since December 1999, because of the beautiful historic centre.  Here the cultures and traditions of the peoples are maintained.

María is 48 years old.  She is a single mother to her 20-year-old son who is studying at university.  She does not have her own house and so lives with her parents, with whom she shares household costs.

María has had a grocery store for six years.  She works seven days a week, with no fixed timetable.  María also offers fast food.

María will use this loan to buy supplies for her shop.

Her dream is to have no debts.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 29-year-old Mariama from Kandehtown Bo. She is married with two children ages 3 years and 8 years. Her children are currently attending school. She began this business because she wants to be independent.

Mariama runs a general store business; she sells soft drinks, Pure Water, biscuits and cigarettes. She has been running this business for eight years. She works at the business throughout the week and 10 hours per day. Mariama says that sometime business is very difficult.

Mariama has requested a loan in order to purchase soft drinks, Pure Water, biscuits and cigarettes for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise more than ever. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, Pure Water, biscuits and cigarettes for resale.

loans.name: Fodia

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 29-year-old Fodia from Kandeh town Bo. She is married with four children between the ages of two months and 14 years. Three of her children are currently attending school. 

Fodia runs a food stand; she sells rice, pepper, and cooking seasoning. She has been running this business for 16 years. She works at the business throughout the week and 10 hours per day.  Fodia says that sometimes business is very difficult.

Fodia has requested a loan in order to purchase cooking seasoning, rice, and oil for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise more than ever. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cooking seasoning, rice, and oil for resale.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Meet 47-year-old Hawa from Kandeh town Bo in Sierra Leone. She is married with one child, age 4 years old. In 2007, Hawa established her food stand business. She began her business because she needs to generate income to take care of herself and her family. She works at the business every day from morning to night. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation.

Hawa requires a loan in order to purchase more onions, groundnut oil and cooking seasonings. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and change her status of living. In the future, Hawa plans to see her business advance to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more onions, groundnut oil and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Brian

texts.es: Brian, de 28 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de su esposa Reyda, con la que tiene un hijo al que cuida en su casa propia. Brian se dedica a la agricultura , sus terrenos se ubican en una zona muy rica para sembrar, por eso posee cultivos de café, piña, plátano y demás. Comenta que desde muy joven comenzó a incursionar en este negocio, por esa razón tiene buenos clientes que son conocedores de la buena cosecha que tiene, la calidad de sus frutos y del esfuerzo que día a día realiza por mantenerlos limpios. Afirma que no tuvo problemas con la plaga que atacó en este año el café, pues tiene plátanos y piñas que le ayudaron a contrarrestar las perdidas que tuvo, pues también sembró el tipo de café inmune a la plaga . Este es su primer préstamo con KIVA y se siente agradecido del apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Brian, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Brian, 28, is a hard-working man. He lives with his wife, Reyda, with whom he has one child who he takes care of in their own home. Brian makes a living in agriculture. His land is located in an area that is very rich for planting, which is why he has coffee, pineapple, banana and other crops. 

He states that he began to venture into this business when he was very young, and for this reason he has good clients who are knowledgeable about his good harvests, the quality of his produce, and the effort that he makes day-to-day to keep them clean.

He states that he had no problems caused by the blight that attacked coffee crops this year, since he has bananas and pineapples that helped him to offset his losses. He also sowed the type of coffee that is immune to the plague. 

This is his first Kiva loan and he feels grateful for the financial support that he receives in order to get ahead. He is also committed to making his payments punctually. Brian will invest the 2000 Peruvian soles in the purchase of organic compost in order to nourish his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic compost for his crops

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Meet 58-year-old Rugiatu from Kandeh town Bo in Sierra Leone. She is married with six children. In 2007, Rugiatu established her palm oil and food stand business. She began her business because she needs to generate income to take care of her family. She works at the business every day from morning to night. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation.

Rugiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more gallons of palm oil, rice and beans. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, Rugiatu plans to see her business advance to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil, rice and beans.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Mamie from Torkpoi Town Bo, in the southern area of Sierra Leone. She is married with five children. She began this business to create a permanent source of income to support herself. 

Mamie runs a palm oil business; she sells palm oil and gari (snack made from cassava) at her house. She has been running this business for five years. She works at the business throughout the week and eight hours per day. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to run her business and price inflation.

Mamie has requested a loan in order to purchase palm oil and beans. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and beans.

loans.name: Bessy Liseth

texts.es: Bessy de 34 años de edad vive en casa  propia  con  su esposo y sus dos hijos , es una persona que se esfuerza por su trabajo y lo desempeña con responsabilidad  ya que a través de su trabajo ella puede darle lo necesario a su hogar,  día a día lucha  para poder dar el sustento diario a su familia , ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Bessy, 34, lives in her own house with her husband and her two children.  She's a person who works hard in her job and carries it out responsibly because with it she can give her household everything they need.  She strives every day to be able to support her family.

She has a store where she sells basic necessities: beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other items.  She has many years of experience in her business, which has given her the necessary sales experience to earn the best profits.  The store's located in her home in a busy area.  She's well known among her neighbors and has acquired a lot of customers because she keeps the store stocked.

She wants to grow her business and make a new investment.  She needs capital, though, so she's requesting a loan to buy what she needs for her store.

She's certain she'll repay the debt and also trusts she'll give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beans, milk, eggs, bread, oil, rice, candy, etc.

loans.name: Las Activas Del Sector C Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo Las Activas del sector C
El grupo está conformado por  06 socias. Marisol es una de ellas y tiene el cargo de tesorera. Ella es casada con 02 hijos, su esposo es técnico electricista  tanto él como ella trabajan para sustentar el hogar. Marisol trabaja como costurera y sus ingresos le permiten ayudar con la educación de sus hijos,  sus vecinos y amigos son sus principales clientes a quienes les brinda servicio de compostura y confección de prendas de vestir, también vende productos de belleza que es un ingreso adicional, este préstamo que ha solicitado le permitirá comprar  materiales  de costura y otra parte lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza. En el futuro le gustaría acondicionar un lugar apropiado en su casa para poner un taller más grande. 
Marisol está contenta y agradecida por el apoyo de los inversores a su grupo comunal, en la foto aparece con casaca color naranja,la foto de la derecha pertenece a la Sra. yolanda
texts.en:
This is the Las Activas Del Sector C group. This communal bank is made up of 6 members. 

Marisol is one of them and she holds the position of treasurer. She is married with 2 children. Her husband is an electrician and so they both work to support the household. Marisol works as a seamstress and her earnings permit her to support her children with their education. Her neighbors and friends are her main customers and she offers the service of sewing and creating clothing and also sells beauty products for additional income.

The loan that she is asking for will allow her to buy sewing supplies and also invest in beauty products. In the future she would like to fix up an appropriate place at home as a bigger workshop.

Marisol is happy and grateful for the support of the lenders to her communal bank. In the photo she appears in the orange jacket. Yolanda is in the photo on the right.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies for her business

loans.name: Sonia Eduvina

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer de 40 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella siempre ha sido padre y madre para sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Sonia no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Diseño de Modas que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar con sus hijos y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para engreírlos.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Sonia trabaja en su pequeño bodega, donde vende golosinas, bebidas y algunos abarrotes, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, Sonia se siente a gusto trabajando y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Sonia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de abarrotes, bebidas y prendas de vestir para su venta, de esta manera Sonia tendrá su negocio mejora abastecido y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Sonia is a 40-year-old woman. She lives in the city of Pisco with her two small children, who she loves and who are her main reason for living. She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who dedicates all her effort to getting her family ahead, since she has always been her children's father and mother. 

Regrettably, due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work from a very young age, Sonia was unable to study the professional degree in Fashion Design that she wanted to pursue. In her free time, she likes to play with her children and on some occasions she cooks a delicious "Carapulcra con Sopa Seca" (A Peruvian meat, potato and noodle dish) to spoil them.

Sonia works in her small store on her own initiative and with much determination and dedication, selling candy, drinks and some groceries. She works every day beginning in the early hours of the morning and she can do so for approximately 10 hours. Sonia enjoys working and believes that it is going well for her because of her good prices and the friendly treatment she offers to others.

Sonia is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help they offer her, she will be able to buy a larger quantity and variety of groceries, drinks, and clothing items to be sold. This way, Sonia will have her business better-stocked and she will be able to attend to more clients. Thus, she will continue working and striving to achieve her great dream of seeing her children become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bathroom in his home

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Cecilia from Kandehtown Bo, a married mother of five children ranging in age from 5 to 22 years. Three of them are currently attending school.

Cecilia began her general stock business eight years ago in order to be independent. Selling soft drinks, pure water, biscuits and sweets, she works 10 hours per day throughout the week. Cecilia says that at present her business is doing well and her customer base has increased.

Cecilia has requested a loan to purchase more soft drinks, pure water, biscuits and sweets for resale. The extra income arising from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise, and she thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, pure water, biscuits and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Forjadores Del Mañana Group

texts.es:
El grupo Forjadores del Mañana está conformado por 08 integrantes. Laura es la secretaria del grupo, ella trabaja para poder mantener a sus hijos de 09 y 02 años. Laura vende productos de belleza empezó con este negocio gracias a una amiga que la animo a trabajar por su cuenta , son cerca de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio que le permitiéndole obtener ingresos sin descuidar a sus hijos, sus clientes son vecinos amigos y familiares. Con el préstamo solicitado empezara otro negocio que es la venta de bisuteria de plata para lo cual invertirá el dinero obtenido. Laura está entusiasmada con este nuevo  reto y espera que le vaya muy bien, por otro lado está muy agradecida a EDAPROSPO por la confianza que le brindan y a todas las personas que sin conocerla le brindan su apoyo.
En la foto esta con chompa color turqueza,la foto de la derecha pertenece a la Sra.Beatriz.
texts.en:
The communal bank Forjadores del Mañana is made up of 8 members.

Laura is the secretary of the group. She works in order to support her children who are 9 and 2 years old.

Laura sells beauty products. She started this business thanks to a friend who encouraged her to work on her own. She has been dedicated to her business for about 11 years permitting her to earn income without neglecting her children. Her customers are neighbors, friends, and relatives. With this loan she will open another business selling silver jewelry using the proceeds of the loan.

Laura is excited about this new challenge and hopes that it goes well, and she is grateful to EDAPROSPO for the trust they have in her and for all the people that offer their help without knowing her.

In the photo she is wearing the turquoise sweater. Beatriz appears in the photo on the right.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry for her business.

loans.name: Jenneh

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Jenneh from Torkpoi town Bo. She is married with 4 children ages 6 to 23 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. She began this business because she wants to be self dependent.

Jenneh runs a general stock business. She sells eggs, pure water, biscuits and bread. She has been running this business for 8 years. She works at the business throughout the week and 10 hours per day.  Jenneh says that sometimes business is very difficult.

Jenneh has requested a loan in order to purchase soft drinks, pure water, biscuits and eggs for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise more than ever. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, pure water, biscuits and eggs for resale

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 39-year-old Mariama from Kandeh town Bo. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 2 months and 14 years. Three of her children are currently attending school. 

Mariama runs a food stand; she sells rice, pepper and cooking seasoning. She has been running this business for 16 years. She works at the business throughout the week and 10 hours per day.  Mariama says that sometimes business is very difficult.

Mariama has requested a loan in order to purchase cooking seasoning, rice and oil for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise more than ever. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cooking seasoning, rice and oil for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy display cabinets.

loans.name: Telma Edelmira

texts.es: Telma de  34 años de edad vive en casa propia  con  su esposo y sus hijos , es una persona que se esfuerza por su trabajo y lo desempeña con responsabilidad  ya que a través de su trabajo ella puede darle lo necesario a su hogar,  día a día lucha  para poder dar el sustento diario a su familia , Telma se dedica a la venta de medicina natural en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia  y adicional a eso tiene una pequeña  tienda que se encuentra ubicada en su casa es de esa manera como ella lucha a diario y puede solventar algunos gastos  de su hogar, Telma esta  solicitando un crédito  todo esto para invertirlo en su negocio y poder comprar más medicinas por mayor ya que últimamente ha tenido mucha demanda, así poder  aumentar sus ganancias,  y de esa manera darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia .
texts.en:
Telma, 34, lives in her own house with her husband and her children.  She's a person who makes the effort in her job and carries it out responsibly because with it she can give her household everything it needs.  She strives every day to support her family.

Telma earns a living selling natural medicine in the market near her home.  She also has a small store in her house.  This way she strives every day and is able to cover some of her household expenses.

Telma's requesting a loan to invest in her business and be able to buy more medicine wholesale.  Lately she has had a lot of demand, so she'll be able to increase her profits and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy natural medicine wholesale

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Meet 32-year-old Rugiatu, from Kandeh town Bo in Sierra Leone. She is married, with three children between the ages of 3 and 15 years.  

In 2007, Rugiatu established her fish business. She began her business because she needed to generate income to take care of herself and her family. She works at the business every day, from morning to night. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation.

Rugiatu requires a loan in order to purchase fish for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. 

In the future, Rugiatu plans to see her business improve to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Baby

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Baby from Kandeh town Bo, in the southern area of Sierra Leone. She is widowed with 5 children between the ages of 5 and 20 years old.

Baby runs a retail business; she sells wood, palm oil, cigarettes and soap at her house. She has been running this business since just after her husband died during the war. She works at the business throughout the week and 8 hours per day. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to run her business and price inflation.

Baby has requested a loan in order to purchase palm oil and charcoal. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and roof her house to protect her residents from the rainy season. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and charcoal

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Bendu from Kandeh town Bo, a southern area in Sierra Leone. She is married, with five children between the ages of 8 and 20 years.

Bendu runs a local soap business. She sells palm oil and gari at her house. She has been running this business for five years. She works at the business throughout the week and eight hours per day. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to run her business and price inflation.

Bendu has requested a loan in order to purchase palm oil and gari. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. 

In the future, she plans to expand her business. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and gari

loans.name: Fuente De Bendicion Group

texts.en:
The Fuente de Bendición (Source of Blessing) Trust Bank is located in one of the many villages of the department of Quetzaltenango, in western Guatemala. Eight women make up this Trust Bank and most of the group has traditional large families. The members of the Source of Blessing Trust Bank have joined Friendship Bridge, a microfinance and education organization in Guatemala in order to have access to working capital to support and expand their businesses.

The loans granted by Friendship Bridge benefit small micro-entrepreneurs. Teresa is one such entrepreneur, and is the secretary of The Fuente de Bendición Trust Bank. Teresa is a 36-year old woman who joined Friendship Bridge more than a year ago and is embarking on her third loan cycle. Currently Teresa’s business is the production and sale of homemade tortillas, which she sells door-to-door. This model has allowed her to build up her client base over time. Teresa is requesting a new loan from Friendship Bridge that she will use to buy an industrial stove, gas, and corn, so she can produce more tortillas is less time. Teresa’s business is generating income that supports all ten family members. Her dream is to expand her current business, and to possibly diversify her product offerings in the in the future to generate additional customers. 

In addition to having access to capital, she also benefits from the monthly trainings she receives from her Friendship Bridge loan officer. In these monthly meetings the women receive educational programming and are encouraged to participate and have a voice on topics such as marketing, savings, sales, and reproductive health, among others.

The Fuente de Bendición Trust Bank is excited that people across the world want to invest in their development, as well the betterment of their families and communities. They want to ensure Kiva investors that they are very thankful and are committed to repaying the capital that they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove, gas, and corn.

loans.name: Progresando En Valores 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Ysabel is the coordinator of her group, Progresando en Valores 1, 2 & 3 (Progress in Values). Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. She makes her home in a simple structure, with her long-term partner and four children.

Ysabel is excited to be taking her seventh loan with Esperanza International Dominican Republic. She has her own business, which she started with some savings almost seven years ago. She plans to use this loan to increase her inventory by buying men's and women's clothes. She will use the profits to finish building her house. 

Ysabel says that her most difficult challenge is to finish building her house. In the meantime, she continues to enjoy sewing. Her dreams are to work hard and move her business forward and, with the help of God, she will. She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothes.

loans.name: Miguel Clemente

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 34 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus padres, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres Miguel pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Agronomía que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Miguel se dedica a la agricultura, el cuenta con una pequeña parcela donde cultiva papa, Miguel realiza labores de campo todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, adicionalmente los fines de semana Miguel trabaja como jornalero de medio tiempo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad.
Miguel se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de riego, abono y fertilización de su cultivo, de esta manera Miguel espera obtener una buena cosecha para luego venderla a un buen precio, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Miguel is 34, single, and lives in the city of Nazca with his parents. He is a very friendly, hand working and enthusiastic individual, who puts all his efforts into moving forwards. Thanks to this effort and the support of his parents, Miguel was able to study the university degree in agriculture he wanted to. In his free time, he enjoys listening to music and he sometimes cooks delicious rice with chicken, which he shares with his family.

On his own initiative, with a lot of hard work and dedication, Miguel works in agriculture. He has a small plot of land where he grows potatoes. Miguel works in the fields every day from early in the morning, for around 8 hours. At weekends, he also works as a part-time labourer in an agricultural foundation in his city.

Miguel is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help, he will be able to cover the costs of watering, putting compost on and fertilising his crops. Miguel hopes to get a good harvest, so that he can sell it at a good price. Therefore, he will keep working hard to achieve his biggest dream of owning his own home.

loans.use: to cover the costs of watering, putting compost on and fertilising his crops.

loans.name: Hen

texts.en:
Hen lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is 25 years old and married with three children, one of whom is dependent and still in school. To support her family, she has been working as a rice farmer. The current business earns her about 33,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day to make a living. She can afford to save 10,000 KHR each day after expenses.

This is Hen’s second loan with VisionFund. She completely paid back the previous one. Now she is asking for another loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for her farmland. With this loan she hopes to make more healthy rice to increase her family’s income, make a living better, and be able to afford some household necessities for the family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Las Cruces Group

texts.en:
The Las Cruces Trust Bank resides in Chuanoj, a community in Totonicapan which is located in southwest Guatemala. Currently the Trust Bank is composed of 12 women, who on average are 32 years old and have about three years of formal education. These women are very responsible, hard-working people who want to improve their lives and the lives of their children. Due to economic constraints, these women were unable to attend school, and had to work from a young age. They struggle daily to raise their young children and provide them with a better future.

Carmen is a 29-year old member of Las Cruces Trust Bank who is married and has five children. Like many families in Chuanoj, Carmen and her husband are weavers. They use foot looms in order to make cortes (or traditional Guatemalan skirts), which they sell in markets nearby. 

Business is doing well and demands are high for their cortes so Carmen and her husband recently decided to hire two full-time employees. She also needs more capital to buy thread in bulk, so she is requesting a loan from Friendship Brige. This way she can keep the price low, increase production and maximize their revenues. She is currently able to fill and deliver orders within an eight-day period and is working hard to shorten the delivery time. 
Beyond receiving the loans, the Las Cruces Trust Bank has also created a circle of trust between its members. The women gather once a month and receive training giving by their Friendship Bridge loan officer. Through these facilitated activities, the women learn about and discuss business issues including budget management, identifying the different ways of do business (personal sales, telephone sales, wholesale sales, retail sales), and costs.  The educational sessions also cover personal issues like health, hygiene, women's rights, and self-esteem. "Learning about these issues is a good benefit to our businesses," explains Carmen.  "And it helps us with personal enrichment."

The Las Cruces Trust Bank acknowledges the importance of Kiva investors supporting them. They understand that in a developing country, such as Guatemala, they can create a decent working environment with your help.

loans.use: To buy thread in bulk

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es una mujer de 44 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposo y sus cinco hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Nelly no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar deliciosos postres para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Nelly trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y ropa, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, Nelly se siente a gusto trabajando y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Nelly se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de abarrotes y prendas de vestir para abastecer su negocio, de esta manera atenderá a mas clientes, así pues Nelly seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Nelly, 44, lives in the city of Pucallpa with her husband and her five children, whom she loves and who are her main purpose in life.
