She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
This is Mary Ann, 32, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to John Paul, a cook, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mary Ann operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Mary Ann hopes that her business will flourish and dreams of having their own house and lot. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda has operated a transportation business for three years. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy tires and motor oil and pay for the motor-vehicle repair and maintenance to provide safe travel to her passengers. In addition, she will encourage more passengers to ride in her motorcycle. 

She is 59 years of age, married and has four children. Erlinda aspires to have a better way of life and have a stable source of income for the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy tires and motor oil and pay for the motor-vehicle repair and maintenance to provide safe travel to her passengers.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 42 years old, married and has four children, two of whom are in school.  

Rowena is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Rowena requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rowena has been farming rice for 10 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Allen Grace

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Allen Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit-selling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Allen Grace is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to purchase more fruits to sell in her food stall.

Allen Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda is 50 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Ermelinda works very hard to provide for them.

Ermelinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ermelinda has been in this business for 19 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Ermelinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita, 59, is from Pingcol, Ozamiz City. She is a widow and has three children. To earn a living, Nenita operates a tailoring business, providing general alterations and tailoring services. Nenita been in this business for more than three years and earns 3,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) per month from the business. 

In 2012, Nenita joined GDMPC. Nenita is requesting a new  loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She plans to use a portion of her additional revenue generated from the business  to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 53 years old and a widowed mother of three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jessie has a general store business in the Philippines. Jessie requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like bread, sardines, sugar and other groceries.

Jessie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jessie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, sardines, sugar and other groceries.

loans.name: Alexis

texts.en:
This is Alexis, 22, a resident of Intramuros, Philippines. Single, he lives with his parents and helps them manage their household  He is working hard to support his family and to help them in terms of finances.

Alexis sells and retails towels. He has different kinds of towels like hand towels, face towels, bath towels and cleaning towels. He also sells different souvenirs for additional income. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy different kinds of towels needed in his business. 

Alexis dreams of expanding his business and hopes that his family’s lives will be better. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for different kinds of towels needed in his business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is patiently operating a piggery business as a source of income. She has two children who are attending school. Her pig raising business serves as a source of funds in sending them there. She wants the business to improve more to gain higher income. 

Elizabeth therefore is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed, vitamins and two more hogs. She is hoping that with his hard work and this loan assistance, she can acquire higher funds and be able to invest towards the development of her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and two more hogs.

loans.name: Ismoiljon

texts.ru: Исмоилджону 42 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Его жена портниха и предоставляет услуги швеи. Детям 19, 17 и 12 лет. Он работает в частной фирме водитель – поставщиком. То есть он раздаёт продуктовым магазинам конфеты, печенья и т.п. Он как заботливый отец старается, чтобы его дети получили высшее образование. Его сын в этом году успешно окончил среднюю школу и поступил в Технический Институт Технологического Университета Таджикистана. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор своего сына, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1100 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Ismoiljon is 42 years old. He is married and raising 3 children. Ismoiljon's wife is a seamstress and provides sewing services. His children are 19, 17 and 12 years of age. Ismoiljon works at a private company as a driver-distributor, delivering sweets, cookies etc. to grocery stores.

As a caring father, Ismoiljon tries to make sure that his children receive post-secondary education. This year, his son successfully graduated from high school and entered the Technical Institute of the Tajikistan University of Technology. Ismoiljon needs to pay his son's tuition fees but has no money to do so. He is requesting a loan of US$1,100 to pay for his son's education and is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his son’s education

loans.name: Gulzadakhan

texts.ru: Гулзадахан, 43 года, замужем, многодетная мать имеет 4 детей (3 сына и 1 дочь). Образование-среднее. С 2003 года занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 10,000 сом (KGS). Супруг помогает по бизнесу. Благодаря упорному труду Гулзадахан, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее  хозяйство: 2 дойные коровы, 15 овец. Также в наличии имеет земельный надел, на которой выращивает: картошку и кукурузу.  Прибыль позволила Гулзадахан размножить скот в домашнем хозяйстве и тем самым улучшить семейное благосостояние. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулзадахан обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70 000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Гулзадахан  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота, а также улучшить материальное положение семьи.
texts.en:
Gulzadakhan is 43 years old, married, and a mother of 4 children (3 sons and 1 daughter). She has secondary education. Since 2003, Gulzadakhan has been engaged in farming - raising livestock and growing crops, having started her business with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulzadakhan's hard work, and to her husband's assistance, the business is currently doing very well. She keeps 2 dairy cows and 15 sheep, while also cultivating a plot of land where she grows potatoes and corn. Her profits have allowed Gulzadakhan to increase the size of her herd and to improve her family's well-being.

In order to continue developing her business, Gulzadakhan has turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum & Partners for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional livestock. She plans to invest her profits from the loan into further expansion of her herd, while also boosting her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Zohirjon

texts.ru: Зохирджону 44 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Его жена работает медсестрой в местной больнице, а дети еще учатся. Зохирджон более 5 лет выращивает хлопок. Он является основным кормильцем семьи и как заботливый отец всегда думает об образовании своих детей. Его сын учится в университете в Российской Федерации. Зохирджон должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2100 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Zohirjon is 44 years old and he is married with three children.  His wife works as a nurse in the local hospital and his children are still in school.  For more than five years, Zohirjon has been growing cotton.  He is the main breadwinner of the family and, like any caring father, he is always thinking about his children's education.  His son is doing his university studies in the Russian Federation.  Zodirjon needs to pay for his son's tuition, but he doesn't have the money.  He is asking for a loan of $2,100 to pay for the tuition.  He is awaiting your kindness and counting on your charity.

loans.use: To pay for his son’s education

loans.name: Sveta

texts.ru: Cвета, 50 лет, замужем, есть дети. С 1996 года Света в поисках доходов для своей семьи стала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Бизнес начала с 15 000 сом (KGS). Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе Света достигла небольших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 13 000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Светы имеется: 3 дойные коровы и 1 лошадь. Также в наличии имеет земельный надел 6,84 ГА на обработку и посадку зерновых культур. По хозяйству помогает супруг. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Света обратилась в «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70 000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для дальнейшего откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Света планирует направить на увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Sveta is 50 years old, married, and has children. In 1996, while looking for a source of income for her family, Sveta started raising livestock and growing crops. She launched her business with 15,000 som (KGS). Through back-breaking labour and constant effort, Sveta has achieved certain success in her business and began earning 13,000 som (KGS) per month. Presently, she keeps 3 dairy cows and 1 horse, and also has 6.84 hectares of land for cultivation of grains. Sveta's husband assists her in the business.

In order to continue developing her business, Sveta has turned to Bai-Tushum & Partners for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock for fattening and resale. She plans to use her profits to increase the size of her herd.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Qimatullo

texts.ru:
Киматулло житель города Куляб. Он 54-летний женатый мужчина. У него трое сыновей и двое дочерей. Двое его старших сыновей находятся на заработках и по мере возможности высылают деньги отцу. Киматулло в данное время не работает. Раньше он работал водителем и имеет в этой области хороший опыт. Киматулло по характеру скромный и добропорядочный человек. 
Он снова хочет начать эту деятельность. Для этого ему необходимо купить машину. У него есть сбережение на сумму 800 долларов США. Он просит в кредит еще 3000 долларов США. Киматулло собирается работать по маршрутной линии город Куляб - город Душанбе и предоставлять жителям услуги такси с шести часов утра до пяти часов вечера. Он по опыте знает, что это прибыльное дело и поэтому хочет заново начать эту деятельность, чтобы улучшить экономическое положение семьи.
texts.en: Qimatullo lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 54 years old and married with three sons and two daughters.  His two elder sons are migrant workers and they send money home when they are able.  Qimatullo doesn't work at the moment.  He used to work as a driver and he has good experience in that line of work.  Qimatullo is a modest and respectable man.  He wants to start up this business again, but he will need to buy a car.  He has $800 in savings, and he is asking for a loan of $3,000.  Qimatullo plans to work a route from Kulob to Dushanbe and to offer his services from 6:00am to 5:00pm.  He knows from experience that this is a lucrative business and that is why he wants to get into it again - to improve his family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy a car to use for his taxi service.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Mariées  majoritairement dans des familles nucléaires avec en moyenne 34 ans et 4 enfants, les membres du groupe Benkadi vivent toutes dans le quartier de Sebenikoro Sept en commune IV du District de Bamako  et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de  mèches, d’habits, de chaussures en plastiques, de poisson séché, de pâtes alimentaires, de brosses et pâtes dentifrices.
Madame Mariam (femme debout en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des pagnes de toutes les qualités: pagnes wax et bazins. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 22 pièces de pagnes wax à Bamako. La revente se fait généralement en ambulant au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000Fcfa qui sera utilisé pour prendre en charge l’entretien des enfants.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group are mainly married and live in nuclear families. They have an average age of 34 and, on average, 4 children and all live in the Sebenikoro Sept district, located in the IV commune of the Bamako District. They got to know each other thanks to neighbourly relationships. In order to increase their capital, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle. The group members are small retailers who sell hair extensions, plastic shoes, dried fish, food paste, brushes and toothpaste.

Mariam (the woman standing second from the right in the picture) has a great reputation as a seller of pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African cloth) of different quality, including wax pagnes and damask cloth. She plans to use her loan to buy 22 pieces of wax pagnes in Bamako. She makes her sales generally on the streets for cash or credit to a clientèle made up mostly of women. She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40 000 francs which will be used to take care of the children.

loans.use: to buy wax pagnes.

loans.name: Hèrèmakono Group

texts.fr: Mariées  majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques avec en moyenne 32 ans et 4 enfants, les membres du groupe Hèrèmakono vivent toutes dans le quartier de Sebenikoro Sept en commune IV du District de Bamako  et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de tasses, condiments (échalotes et poudre de gombo), habits pour enfants, poisson fumé, pommade et lait pour la  peau.  Madame Aiché (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de tasses de qualité de toutes sortes (tasses inox, super et aluminium). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 6 complets de tasses inox à Bamako. La revente se fait généralement en ambulant au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Elle espère avoir un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60 000fcfa qui sera utilisé pour assurer l’entretien des enfants. Tout comme les autres femmes du groupe, Madame Mariam a pour objectif de réinvestir l’épargne dans l’activité afin de devenir grossiste.
texts.en:
The members of the Hèrèmakono group are married and live mostly in monogamous families. They have an average age of 32 and, on average, 4 children and all live in the Sebenikoro Sept district, located in the IV commune of the Bamako District. They got to know each other thanks to neighbourly relationships. In order to increase their capital, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle. The group members are small retailers who sell pots, condiments (shallots and gumbo powder), children's clothing, smoked fish, creams and body milk.

Aiché (the woman sitting on the far right in the picture) is a big seller of different types of pots (stainless steel, super and aluminium) of varied quality. She plans to use her loan to buy 6 sets of stainless steel pots in Bamako. She makes her sales generally on the streets for cash or credit to a clientèle made up mostly of women. She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 60 000 francs which will be used to take care of the children. As with the other group members, Mariam's aim is to reinvest her savings into her business so that she can become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy pots.

loans.name: Zolbootuya

texts.en: Mrs. Zolbootuya, a 39-year-old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on plot of land. She has been selling sausages to local people by renting a stall at food market for the past five years. Her husband has position of serviceman at a train station and has been working since 2002. The ger the family lives in has been deteriorating over the years. Especially in winter time, her children get cold and chill down to their cores. So, she is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase felt, hardwood flooring and a low pressure heater in order to create a warm and comfortable place for her family. She wants to replace old felts with new ones and install hardwood floors due to the floor being main source of heat loss. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who wants her children to get a good education and live happily.

loans.use: to purchase felt, hardwood flooring, and a low pressure heater to improve her housing conditions.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 28-year-old married woman with four children; she lives in Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Her husband works as an electrician and she helps him to augment their living situation by operating a service-based business providing motorcycle rentals and transportation. She also has a sari sari store selling goods in their local community. Recently, she joined Gata Daku MPC and borrowed a loan amount to buy additional goods like dairy products and canned goods; a portion will also be used for motorcycle repairs. She is hopeful to improve her business and to see her children become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional goods like dairy products and canned goods, and a portion will be used for motorcycle repairs.

loans.name: Kènèya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe Kènèya sont mariées  majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques avec en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants; Elles vivent toutes dans le quartier de Kanadjiguila en commune IV du District de Bamako  et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, elles ont fait recours à SORO YIRIWASO et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits de la fripouille, du bois de chauffe, des chaussures plastiques, des pagnes wax, bazins, des brochettes de viande et du poisson fumé. 
 Madame Kadiatou (femme assise au milieu sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de chaussures en plastique  de toutes les pointures. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 500 paires de chaussure à Bamako. La revente se fait généralement en ambulant au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Elle compte avoir un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32 000fcfa qui sera utilisé pour réinvestir dans l’activité et assurer les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The 7 members of the Kènèya group are married and live mostly in monogamous families. They have an average age of 39 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in the Sebenikoro Sept district, located in the IV commune of the Bamako District and got to know each other thanks to neighbourly relationships. In order to increase their capital, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle. The group members are small retailers who sell second hand clothing, firewood, plastic shoes, wax pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African cloth), damask cloth, meat kebabs and smoked fish.

Kadiatou (the woman sitting in the middle of the picture) is a big seller of plastic shoes of all sizes. She plans to use her loan to buy 500 pairs of shoes in Bamako. She makes her sales generally on the streets for cash or credit to a clientèle made up mostly of women. She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 32 000 francs which she will reinvest in her business and use to take care of the children's healthcare expenses.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Jesugnon 6 Group

texts.fr: JESUGNON 6 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres des amies et vivent dans la même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité et de faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe s'est rapproché de ALIDé, en vue de l'obtention d'un crédit. La présidente du groupe, Floride âgée de 44 ans (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est mariée à un marchand du nom de Sylvain et est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple. Floride vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Floride n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille, Floride vend divers articles (riz, sucre, savon, lait etc) à son domicile depuis huit ans. De façon secondaire, Floride vend également du charbon de bois. Floride s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de plus en plus forte de la clientèle, Floride sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe JESUGNON 6 pour une septième fois de prêt auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Jesugnon 6 is a group of three persons. The group members are friends and live in the same neighborhood. In order to improve their businesses and satisfy the needs of their clientele, this group reached out to ALIDé, intending to receive a loan. The president of the group, Floride, aged 44, (the woman whose hand is raised in the photo), is married to a merchant named Sylvain and is the mother of five children, all enrolled in school and still supported by their parents. 

Floride lives with her husband and children. The couple share in supporting their family. Floride did not attend school. In order to cater for the needs of her family, Floride has been selling various items (rice, sugar, soap, milk, etc.) at her house for eight years. Besides these items, she also sells charcoal. She buys her stock in a market in Benin. 

Wishing to expand her business and satisfy the growing demand of her clientele, Floride is asking, together with the other members of her group Jesugnon 6, for her seventh loan from ALIDé. The prior loans have been correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn. Her previous loan was a big help to her business. She was able to have her boarding house repaired and maintained. The loan also helped in the education of her children as well as in their household expenditures. She is also a jeepney operator. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan for the repair and maintenance of her boarding house. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jocelyn hopes that her business will run smoothly and dreams that her family will always be happy and peaceful. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintainance of her boarding house.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
This is Noemi; she is 50 years old and a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is single and works hard to provide for her everyday needs.

Noemi buys and sells charcoal. She buys a big quantity of charcoal and then sells them per plastic or per sack. She also sells pork, chicken, and some frozen and processed food for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 6,000 in sales weekly.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of charcoal and additional capital for her frozen products. 

Noemi dreams that her business will expand and hopes to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stocks of charcoal and additional capital for her frozen products.

loans.name: Garfil

texts.en:
This is Garfil; he is 61 years old and a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. He is married to Amelita, a housekeeper, and is the father to their children. He, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Garfil operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 350 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory.

Garfil hopes that his business will grow bigger and dreams that his family will have a better living. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is a 36-year-old married mother of an only child and lives in Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her family. Her husband is an electrician, and she also earns a living with her retail store. For eight years, she has been doing this business in order to augment their situation. She has recently became a member of Gata Daku MPC. Evelyn borrowed a loan to buy raw ingredients, biscuits, and pots for her cooked snacks for sale. She plans to use the generated revenue from her business as an additional capital to increase their income. Hopefully, she can build a store of her own to be used for her business in the near future.

loans.use: a loan to buy raw ingredients, biscuits, and pots for her cooked snacks for sale.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en: Lerma, aged 33, would like to increase the profit she is earning every day to sufficiently meet her children's needs. For this reason, Lerma is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy hard woods to make charcoal for sale. She is very industrious, humble and friendly. These are her strengths to keep on earning a good income and attract other people to buy her products. She just hopes that her business will continue to grow in order so she can save for the education of her three children.

loans.use: to buy hard woods to make charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
This is Merly, 63, resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is single and she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Merly operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business.

Merly dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Iris

texts.en: Iris is 33 years old and single. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a food production business to earn a living; she sells longanisa and dried fish in the local community. She has been with her business for more than two years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Now she has requested a new loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional items such as longaniza (pork sausages), raw ingredients and dried fish. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase food items such as longaniza, raw ingredients,  and dried fish.

loans.name: Precelyn

texts.en: Precelyn is 43 years old and married with three children. She is a sociable person who operates a retail store business. To satisfy the needs of her customers, she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, biscuits, and soft drinks. She hopes that her business will expand further so that she can provide for all the needs of her family especially her children's education.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, biscuits and soft drinks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ankhbayar

texts.en: Mr. Ankhbayar, 25 years old, lives with his wife, two children, and mother in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. He has been repairing and selling mobile phones for living since 2009. His wife recently began running small pawnshop. His mother has retired from work and gets a state pension. His mother looks after his two children at home. He wants to make an extension to his house as his children are getting bigger and bigger each passing day. He wants to create separate rooms for his children to study and sleep. So he is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as planks, metal, cement, and bricks. Using those materials, he will make the necessary extension to his house. Aside from providing additional space for the family, the extension also has environmental benefits as it will distribute heat loss and maintain heat longer. The family will begin to burn less coal for heating and contribute to the efforts against air pollution by releasing less pollutants. The borrower is very hardworking young person who values his family over anything.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as planks, metals, cements, and bricks.

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en: Lorie is 43 years old and is managing her hog fattening business industriously in their village. Due to the hardships of life, she committed herself in this livelihood to get ahead. She aims to improve her small business to support her family. However, she suffers insufficient funds, and to solve this dilemma, she is seeking an additional working capital of PHP 13,000 to buy feed, vitamins and medicines. She hopes to maintain the business well with this financial help she is asking.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and medicines for her hog raising business.

loans.name: Hania

texts.en:
This is Hania, 44 years old and a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Nasser, a vendor and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Hania operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Hania hopes that her business will expand and grow. She dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her general store business.

loans.name: Filiton I Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   FILITON I   est constitué  9  de femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de   35  ans, 5  enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à   ZAMBOUROULA, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur 9 eme  prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée par  Yaou,   la 1ére femme debout de la droite vers la gauche est le riz.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter la semence pour exploiter  1hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à ZAMBOUROULA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 60.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur ménage.
texts.en:
The group "FILITON I" is composed of nine married women, who average 35 years of age and five children each, all living in polygamous families in ZAMBOUROULA, a village in BOUGOUNI (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their rainy season farm work. They are on their ninth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

Rice is the crop grown by Yaou, who is the first woman standing from the right. With her loan, she intends to purchase seeds to make use of 1 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and in ZAMBOUROULA. She plans on making a profit of 600,000 francs CFA per planting. The profit will enable her to pay back the loan and help her husband to cover the day-to-day expenses of their household.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs and plowing for planting crops

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Altantsetseg, 34 years old, lives with her husband and eight year old son in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. They live in their own house on a plot of land. 

She has been operating a bakery for fifteen years and people who taste her baked goods say it is the most delicious cake I have ever eaten. Her husband is on disability due to an accident at the factory and now he gets a state pension. She has used her previous loan to make an extension to her house and it has made the house more comfortable and warmer. 

Now she is requesting a loan of 7000000 MNT to purchase and install an electric boiler into her house for heating. As a result, the family will be able to give up coal for heating and contribute to the efforts against air pollution as burning coal is the main source of air pollution in Mongolia. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who wants her husband and son to live in a warm and comfortable place.

loans.use: to purchase and install an electric boiler into her house

loans.name: Kifayat

texts.en: Kifayat is an IDP (internally displaced person) from the Kalbadjar region. Now she lives in the Absheron region with her family. Kifayat is 56 years old, married, and has 6 children. Three of them are married, and the other three go to university. Kifayat started her food product sales business a year ago. Now Kifayat needs a loan of 2,300 AZN to buy household product. In a future she wants to use the profit to pay for her children's education. In the future, Kifayat wants to have a better place for food production sales too. This will be more profitable for her business. Kifayat is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting her again.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Baasansuren

texts.en:
Mr. Baasansuren, 43 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. He and his wife have been crafting and selling traditional souvenirs and home products using sheep wool. Their main clients are outlets and vendors at outdoor market. They have been running their business for thirteen years and have accumulated a vast amount of experience. 

Using his previous loan, he has purchased raw materials such as sheep wool and other materials. Now he is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to purchase silver, brass, paints and other raw materials. Their business is currently experiencing a shortage of metals to decorate sheep wool souvenirs, so purchasing these materials will help his business to prosper. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase silver, brass and paints

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela lives in the village of Tsodniskari of the Lagodekhi District. She is 55 years old and lives with her husband, Malkhaz. Natela is a shepherd and earns a small monthly income (approximately $100-110 per month). She runs a small scale agricultural business and owns a cow and two pigs. The family lives in poverty and receives a small monthly social assistance from the local government. As the living conditions are very poor, Natela and Malkhaz decided to start their business, but found that they didn’t have enough money to do so.

Natela’s loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with reasonable conditions to the country's vulnerable poor who do not have access to other credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low incomes.

With this loan, Natela will purchase a car and her husband will serve the local people as a taxi driver. The income of the family will increase, and they will be able to improve their living conditions. In addition, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her husband to use as a taxi.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 51 years old and has been raising hogs for over seven years. Her income from hog-raising supports her family especially her children's education. She is thankful for having this business because it was a great help in improving their poor living conditions. She wishes to increase the sales of her hogs as well as to satisfy her product consumers by providing them with a quality product (healthy and well grown hogs). 

To make this possible, Lilibeth is requesting an additional loan of working capital in the amount of PHP 8,000 to buy the needed supply of feed, medicine and vitamins. This loan will help her realize her business endeavor.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine and vitamins

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en:
Mr. Erdenebat, 35 years old, lives with his wife and children in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. He has been working as a carpenter at a museum for one year. His wife has been making dresses at a tailoring factory since 2009. Their children go to high school. 

The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years so Erdebebat is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, planks, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, he will repair and insulate his old house and create a comfortable and warm place for his family. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution by releasing fewer pollutants into air. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria vive junto con su familia en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 31 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos a quienes saca adelante, ella alterna las actividades del hogar con brindar servicios de llamadas, ella sale muy temprano de su casa se instala en una esquina de la calle o sea de forma ambulatoria entonces las personas utilizan sus celulares para realizar llamadas a otros celulares o teléfonos fijos entonces ella cobra el minuto de llamada a cincuenta centavos de nuevo sol. (S/. 0.50). Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para recargar con minutos los celulares para que las personas realicen las llamadas. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Victoria, 31, lives with her family in the beautiful city of Paucartambo, Cusco Department.  She’s in a common law relationship and has three children she supports.  

She alternates her household activities with providing phone services.  She heads out from home very early and sets up on a corner or goes from place to place.  Clients use the cell phones to call other cell phones or fixed line phones and she charges fifty cents per minute.  She’s been in this business several years now and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  

She’s a member of the “Mamacha Carmen” communal bank and on this occasion needs the loan to add minutes to her cell phones so people can make calls.  She is grateful for and values the loan and commits to make her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to recharge cell phones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth, age 35, operates a hog fattening business as an added source of income. She has been in this business for almost five years, and usually receives PHP 5,000  after selling her fattening hog. 

She would like to improve her sales for the security and benefit of her three children, who are studying. 

Therefore, she is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed and vitamins for the maintenance and growth of her hogs. With her hard work and this loan assistance, she knows that someday, the business will get bigger and sustainable then, somehow, her family will achieve a good life.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for the maintenance and growth of her hogs .

loans.name: Lucilli Elena

texts.es: La cliente reside en Durán.  Años atrás se desempeñaba como ayudante en un gabinete de belleza y cuando la liquidaron, decidió hacer manicure por el sector donde vive.  Más adelante ya pudo establecer su negocio propio, en donde su hermana la ayuda a laborar diariamente.  Es soltera y tiene un niño que va a una escuela particular.  Tiene en mente poder ampliar su gabinete a futuro.  Necesita el crédito para comprar artículos de belleza para su negocio.
texts.en:
This borrower resides in Durán.  Years ago, she worked as an assistant at a beauty salon.  When she was laid off, she decided to offer manicures in the area where she lives.  Later on, the borrower decided to establish her own business.  Her sister helps her and they work every day.  

The borrower is single and has a child who is attending a private school.  She intends to expand her business in the future.  She needs a loan in order to buy beauty supplies for her business.

loans.use: to purchase beauty supplies for her business.

loans.name: Tsend-Ayush

texts.en:
Mr. Tsend-Ayush, 30 years old, lives with his wife and child in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in an old house on a plot of land. 

He began selling automobile spare parts last year. He has a secondary education level because he chose to work at his brother's automobile sales business instead of attending the university. For five years, he has repaired and sold cars and accumulated a vast amount of experience in automobile related works. 

The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years and it needs some serious repair. So he is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, planks, fiberglass, and foam. Using those materials, he will repair and insulate his old house, thus creating a comfortable and warm accommodation for his family. Most importantly the renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating, and release less pollutants into into the air, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is from Tabo-o, Jimenez. She is 48 years old and is married with five children. To make a living, Emelia sells fish while her husband does the fishing. She has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2011, Emelia joined GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing  nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fishing  nets

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is 62 years old and lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental with her children.  Florita is widowed, and has two children. 

To make a living, Florita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products and groceries in the local community. Florita has been in business for years, and earns 8,500 PHP a month. 

In 2007, Florita joined GDMPC and is now requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase canned goods and feed to sell. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods and feed to sell.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: El señor Nicolas es casado con la señora Justina  15 años, tienen 5 hijos dependientes, de diferentes edades que estudian en nivel primaria y secundaria, la familia vive en una comunidad pobre hace 20 años atrás, se dedican a la producción agrícola de papa, haba, oca, papaliza, como también cuentan con cabezas de ganado vacuno 1 lechera y 4 de engorde. El señor Nicolas y su familia son de escasos recursos económicos que a veces apenas cubre los gastos para el estudio de sus hijos, ellos necesitan dinero para compra de insumos agrícolas por esta razón él y su esposa solicitan un préstamo para comprar abono orgánico (gallinaza) mas semilla de papa, ya que ellos sufrieron gastos económicos al hacer arreglar su vehículo que lo tienen para el traslado a su fuente laboral agrícola. Finalmente el señor Nicolas indica que con este crédito  sembraran una mayor superficie para así poder mejorar la calidad de vida y así continuar luchando para salir adelante económicamente.
texts.en: Señor Nicolas has been married to Señora Justina for 15 years. They have 5 dependent children of various ages who are in primary and secondary school. The family has lived in the same community for 20 years. They work in agriculture, producing potatoes, broad beans, oca (a tuberous vegetable), and ulloco (another edible tuber similar to a potato), and they also have several head of cattle: 1 milk cow and 4 cows to fatten. Señor Nicolas and his family are of scarce economic resources, which at times barely cover the school expenses for their children. They need money to buy agricultural supplies. For this reason, he and his wife are applying for a loan to buy organic fertilizer (poultry manure) and more seed potatoes, since they are suffering from economic expenses to repair their vehicle, which they have for transportation to their agricultural workplace. Finally, Señor Nicolas indicates that with this loan they will plant a greater area to thus be able to improve their quality of life and continue striving to advance economically.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Leona

texts.en:
This is Leona. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more pork and beef needed in her business. The loan also helped in their everyday expenses. Aside from selling pork and beef, she is also selling different beverages for additional income.

She would now like to apply for a 14,000 PHP loan to buy different beverages needed in her business. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Leona hopes that her business will be more flourishing and dreams of becoming rich. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
This is Marcelina. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials like wire and basket and supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from his business will definitely help her cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marcelina's dreams is for her business to expand and grow. She meets up with her fellowship co-members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies there.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials like wire and basket and supplies such as seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Ayesha's Group

texts.en:
Ayesha is a 37-year- old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  Her husband drives an auto rickshaw and earns a very low income; that is why she started to teach the students in her home. She teaches from 1st standard to 5th standard students.  

She has been teaching since 2005, and equally participates in daily household expenses and monthly savings. Along with teaching, she also owns  a small stationery stall in her home for her students. In her stall, she sells copies, lead pencils, drawing pencils, canvass, books, etc.

Due to the increase in students, the demand for stationery also increased. Therefore, she requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she could buy more stationery for her students.

She also teaches her own children in her tuition centre, and she drives sufficient income from this practice at the end of the month.

She is very glad after taking this loan, and praises the lenders who take an active part in Kiva.

Note: Ayesha has her hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: To buy books, copies, and stationery such as lead pencils, drawing pencils, calculators, and scales for her tuition centre.

loans.name: Deliles

texts.es: Deliles tiene 30 años, está casada, y vive en su casa propia junto sus 4 hijos. Deliles se dedica a la venta de comidas por las noches. Para eso instala una mesa en al frente de su casa donde atiende muy amablemente a todos sus clientes. Lleva más de 06 años en éste negocio, empezando con un capital propio. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene ya que en su zona no existen ningún otro puesto de comidas. Comenta que se decidió por éste oficio pues le gusta la cocinar. Por tanto, viendo lo rentable que es su negocio, y los pedidos que tiene, desea empezar y continuar hasta hacerlo crecer y en un futuro poder abrir otro negocio ya que le gusta la cocina. Esto será su primer préstamo con Kiva. Está contenta de saber que contará con un apoyo financiero para concretar  sus planes. Por tanto se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto de 500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de utensilios para su negocio como ollas, vasos, platos, y otros, también ingredientes  para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Deliles is 30 years old, she is married and she lives in her own house with her 4 children. Deliles engages in selling meals at night, and for this reason she has set a table outside her house where she very kindly serves all her customers. 

She has been engaged in this activity for more than 6 years, starting with her own working capital. Her business is very profitable, given the demand for her products and that there are no other food vendors in the area. She says she has opted for this activity because she likes cooking. Therefore, considering how profitable her activity is as well as the requests she has, she wants to keep on working to make her activity grow in order to succeed in opening another activity in the future, because she likes cooking. 

This will be her first Kiva loan. Knowing that she will count on financial support to complete her plans makes her happy; therefore she commits to being responsible with the repayment of her dues. She will invest the 500 PEN she is requesting in the purchase of tools for her activity such as pots, glasses, dishes, and other items, as well as in  the purchase of ingredients to prepare her meals.

loans.use: to buy pots, glasses and dishes.

loans.name: Cinthya

texts.es: Cinthya tiene 25 años, es soltera y vive en compañía de su madre. Cinthya se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles desde un puesto en su casa. Tiene más de 02 años dedicándose a éste negocio y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su madre, quien atiende cuando ella está fuera de casa. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera ingresos económicos y se siente ocupada, además el poder estar en casa y ayudar en los gastos del hogar. Considera a su negocio rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja y la regular demanda que tiene desde que se inició en su negocio. Por tanto tiene planes de seguir creciendo en su negocio y ampliarlo vendiendo bebidas gaseosas. Este será el segundo préstamo con Kiva. Está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto de 900 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de mercadería como bebidas gaseosas, arroz, azúcar para vender.
texts.en:
Cinthya, 25, is single living with her mother.  Cinthya works selling food in a stand at home.  She’s been in this business for more than two years and to date does it with her mother’s help who takes care of it when she’s away from home.  She likes her business because it generates income and she keeps busy and besides she can be at home and help with household expenses.  She considers her business to be profitable because of the good profits she nets and because of the steady demand she’s had ever since she started the business.  Therefore, she plans to continue growing in her business and to expand it by selling soft-drinks.

This will be her second Kiva loan.  She’s very happy to know that she will be able to count on financial support because she’ll feel sure of being able to advance in business this way.  She will use the 900 new soles to buy merchandise like soft-drinks, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Lirio

texts.en: Lirio manages both a hog raising business and a variety store. She has been running her variety store for two years and raising hogs for three years. She is 22 years old, married, and has two children. The couple both work hard in order to earn enough income to cover their family’s everyday expenses. She would like to buy a stock of grocery items to her variety store, so she is applying for an additional capital loan of PHP 7,000. This loan will be used to buy grocery items, such as soft drinks, noodles and canned goods. She knows that borrowing this amount will help her make progress toward realizing her dreams in the business. She hopes that the loan she is requested will be granted.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, noodles and canned goods, to sell in her store.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita lives in a place wherein most of families' main source of income is from corn farming, vegetables and hog-raising. She is thankful because, through her perseverance and determination in life, she has been able to manage her farming and hog-raising business well. She is married and has three children. Two of her children have married already while her other child is single and lives with them. 

She aims to have a continuous growth of business so she can make it a viable source of her family income. She is asking for financial assistance from lenders amounting to PHP 12,000. This amount will be used to purchase hog feed and farm supplies for her farming business. Estrelita knows that this amount will help her to achieve her goals in life.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and farm supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: El Oro  (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal El Oro se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este es un grupo formado por 10 mujeres y 3 hombres que al darse cuenta de la ayuda que les brinda la institución decidieron unirse y formar este grupo el cual les va a ayudar a salir adelante, ellos se dedican a varias actividades entre prestación de servicio y comercio en general.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Carmen, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 22, 20 y 17 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en universidad y el menor  en colegio. Su esposo es chofer.

Doña Carmen es una muy buena madre y esposa que para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, electrodomésticos y muebles, estos productos los vende atreves de catálogos, ella enseña los productos a sus clientes y una vez que ellos seleccionan lo que quieren realiza el pedido a la distribuidora y luego entregar a sus clientes, ella también vende productos de Esika, Lebel y Sayson (perfumes, cremas, bisutería entre otras cosas), ella entrega a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, lleva 5 años en este negocio y  le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, cremas, perfumes, bisutería y varios productos más que ella vende. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda para financiar su negocio. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.

La foto pequeña es de una socia y dos socios que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The "El Oro" Communal Bank meets every 15 days in Cantón Montecristi, known for its rich colonial history and handicrafts that are known nationally and internationally. It is the place of the famous straw hats.

This group consists of 10 women and 3 men who upon discovering the help available from the institution decided to unite and form this group to help them succeed. They have various businesses from personal services to general retail.

One of the members of this group is 40 year old Carmen. She is married and has three children, ages 22, 20 and 17. The two oldest study at the university and the youngest is in high school. Her husband is a driver.

Carmen is a very good mother and wife who helps her husband with the household expenses through her retail business. She sells all kinds of clothing, domestic appliances and furniture; she sells these products through catalogs. She shows the products to her customers and once they make their selections of what they want she places the order with the distributor and then delivers the products to her customers. She also sells Esika, Lebel and Sayson products (perfumes, creams, costume jewelry and other items); she delivers on credit and collects payment every 8 days. She has been in this business for 5 years and it is going very well.

This loan is to buy clothing, creams, perfumes, costume jewelry, and various other products that she can sell. This is her third cycle in the Communal Bank and she likes the loans as they are a great financial help to her business.

Her dream is that her children become good professionals. 

The small photo is of three members that couldn't be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy clothing, creams, perfumes, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 35 years old and sells cereals in Oloitoktok town. She is married and has six children.  She currently makes a monthly income of 9,000 Kenya shillings. Her husbands also supports the family with additional income.

This is Faith's third loan term and she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of cereals for sale in her business. These include rice, green grams, maize, wheat and beans. She will use the anticipated income to buy more stock of cereals.

Faith hopes to grow her business by supplying cereals to different places and thus make more income.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cereals to sell.

loans.name: Marietha

texts.en:
This is Marietha, 49, a resident of Intramuros, Philippines. She is married to Jose, who is also her business partner, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Marietha operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for any item in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five pesos worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She makes a profit by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day. She is applying for a PHP 30,000 loan to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. Marietha dreams of expanding her business and hopes to have good health and a bright future for her family. She dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
This is Juanita. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more eggs and grocery items needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a canteen for additional income.

She would now like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan to buy more eggs and grocery items needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Juanita hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams of having a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more eggs and grocery items needed in her business.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
This is Ma. Victoria. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Victoria dreams to have a grocery store and hopes to have their own house and lot.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita. Her previous loan was a big help in her business as well as in the education of her children and their everyday expenses. She has been in this business for three years now. She and her husband, who is working as a farmer, are helping each other in generating income for their family.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to pay for dried fish she needs in her business. The more dried fish displayed at her stall, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Teresita dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her family will have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partner /clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans

loans.use: to pay for dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is a 42-year-old married woman who lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children and equally responsible for all of them. 

She belongs to the category of the ultra-poor, which is why she cannot afford the educational expenses of all of her children. One of her sons helps his father in his business. Her husband owns a blacksmith shop. He provides welding services as well as door-to-door services to his customers. 

Due to an increase in the prices of iron, he is unable to buy sufficient welding materials, such as iron rods, iron sheet, soldering rods and welding rods, to carry on his business. To fulfill customer demand and to run his enterprise, he needs capital to buy welding materials.  

Farzana has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to buy materials to carry on his business. She is very glad and thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy iron rods, iron sheet, soldering rods, and welding rods for her husband's welding business

loans.name: Batzaya

texts.en: Mr. Batzaya, 30 years old, lives with his wife, child and parents in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He has taken vocational training at mining project and, staring next month, he will be working in the mine. His wife has been selling clothes and toys for children for five years. His parents have retired and receive state pensions. His mother and father, though retired, are still contributing to the family income by working as a cook and a carpenter, respectively. He used his previous loan on insulating the walls and roof, but the house still loses heat through its roof. He is applying for a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy and spray foam into the curb roof (a gambrel roof or mansard roof). As a result, the house will stop losing heat through the roof, and the family will burn less coal for heating, thus releasing fewer pollutants into the air and contributing to the efforts to combat air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy insulation material to spray into the roof of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for her husband to sell at a profit.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: Prak is 50 years old. She lives in the Baray district of Kompong Tom, located to the northeast of Phnom Penh. She is a widow who works hard to bring up her two children until they are married. She relies completely on income from agriculture, such as growing rice and raising some animals and poultry in her yard. Despite adversities, she aims to continue to grow her farming business and to improve it to a commercial farming level.  At the moment, she would like to have loan support, so she will be able to renovate her house. She will use this loan to buy strong house columns to replace in those in her house and to buy planks of wood and timbers needed for construction. Her future dreams involve buying a bigger piece of land and planting more rice to ensure a high production and income.

loans.use: to buy strong house columns to replace the ones in her house and to buy planks of wood and timbers needed for construction.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a loyal partner from Cavite, Philippines. Her variety store is going strong as she is using the money in her business. Her income from her business is helping her in sending her children to school and in sustaining her family's everyday needs. She and her husband are continuously working to provide for their everyday needs. 

She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Merlita dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes to give her family a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she draws strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:
Glory, 50, has four grown children. She remains responsible for the daily needs of her family. She is very hardworking and kind to her community.
 
To make her business more productive and competitive, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos. She will use the loan to purchase canned goods, food snacks, shampoo, soap and toothpaste to sell in her store. 

In the future, Glory hopes that her business will further expand so that she can save enough money for the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, food snacks, shampoo, soap and toothpaste to sell in her store.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
