As she expanded her business, she added selling bed sheets, magic pillows, and some fruits. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy towels, bed sheets, magic pillows and other products needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

She dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes that her family will have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for towels, bed sheets, magic pillows and other products needed in her business

loans.name: Astrid Elena

texts.es: Astrid, con 21 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, activa y pujante. Por falta de oportunidades de empleo, decidió iniciar su propio negocio para conseguir ingresos por su propia cuenta; su actividad consiste en la comercialización de frutas y verduras, las cuales compra al por mayor a los campesinos que las cosechan y luego las vende en diferentes legumbrerías del pueblo donde reside y en plaza del municipio, de esta forma ha logrado obtener los recursos para aportar a la economía de su hogar. El crédito que solicita, desea invertirlo en la compra de surtido (papa capira y papa criolla) al por mayor, para aprovechar los descuentos que obtiene por la compra de contado; esto le permitirá tener disponibilidad de productos para incrementar sus ventas y cumplir con los pedidos que le realizan, de esta manera tendrá  mejores ingresos y podrá seguir avanzando para cumplir el sueño de tener una bodega para almacenar sus productos y poder ampliar su negocio en un corto plazo, así tendrá más oportunidades de salir adelante y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Astrid, 21, is an enterprising, active, and thriving woman.  Because of a lack of job opportunities she decided to start her own business to earn income on her own.

Her job is selling fruits and vegetables, which she buys wholesale from the farmworkers who harvest them.  Then she sells them in different vegetable stores in the town where she lives and in a plaza in a nearby city.  This way she has been able to earn money to contribute to the household expenses.

The loan she's requesting is to invest in buying stock wholesale ("capira" and "criolla" potatoes) to make the most of the discounts received for paying in cash.  This will allow her to have products available to increase her sales and fill her orders.

She'll have better income and be able to continue making progress toward her dream of having a warehouse to store her products and be able to expand her business in the short term.  She'll have more opportunities to get ahead and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy potatoes

loans.name: Abboud

texts.en:
Abboud is from Iraq. He is a hard working client of 63 years of age who is married and has 3 children. Abboud and 2 of his children provide the family income together.

Abboud owns a small grocery store where he sells canned food, snacks, soft drinks, detergents and shampoos. He has been practicing this business since 2000 and since then, he has been providing his family with the profit he gained from this grocery store. Abboud is a well-known person in the neighborhood and has earned the respect of many.

Abboud is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD in order to buy a motor generator. He is aiming to grow in this field so that one day he may open a bigger supermarket and provide his children a good career.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is a married woman and has four children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a kiosk business. Her potential customers are passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuations of products in the market and transportation.

With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of beans, bars of soap, cooking oil, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, bars of soap, cooking oil, and wheat flour

loans.name: Felipe Antonio

texts.es: El cliente vive en el sector de Suburbio en Guayaquil.  Empezó vendiendo legumbres en su casa, donde tenía una pequeña tienda.  Cuando se percató de que tenía buena venta, decidió dedicarse exclusivamente a la venta de verduras al por mayor y menor.  Trabaja desde las 5 am hasta las 12 pm en el mercado.  Está casado y su esposa labora en un bar de la escuela que administra uno de sus hijos.  Tiene 3 hijos y todos son mayores de edad, solo el soltero vive con ellos.  Por ahora necesita el dinero para adquirir frutas y legumbres para su negocio.
texts.en:
This client lives in the Suburbio sector of Guayaquil.  He started out selling vegetables at home where he had a small store.  When he noticed that sales were good he decided to work exclusively selling vegetables at wholesale and retail.  He works from 5am until 12pm in the market.  

He’s married and his wife works in a school snack bar that one of their children manages.  He has three children who are all adults but the single one still lives with them.  At the moment, he needs the money to buy fruit and vegetables for his business.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La cliente vive en el sector de Isla Trinitaria en Guayaquil.  Empezó hace ya 15 años con la elaboración de calzado bajo pedido para sus clientes.  En la actualidad distribuye al por mayor, especialmente en las zonas más comerciales de la ciudad y también los comercializa en su local.  Generalmente trabaja sola, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su hijo; su horario es de 8 am a 6 pm.  Es soltera y desea a futuro poder ampliar su local y comprarse un vehículo.  Desea el dinero del préstamo para invertirlo en zapatos y materia prima para su negocio.
texts.en: This client lives in Guayaquil’s Isla Trinitaria zone.  She started manufacturing shoes to order 15 years ago.  She currently sells them at wholesale especially in the city’s most commercial zones and she also sells them in her shop.  She usually works alone but occasionally gets help from her son.  Her schedule is 8am to 6pm.  She’s single and hopes in future to expand her shop and buy a vehicle.  She wants the loan money to buy shoes and raw materials for her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank and more taps and pipes

loans.name: María Dolly

texts.es: María, a sus 46 años de edad es casada y madre de 3 hijos. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la producción agropecuaria, pero por dificultad en las ventas y los altos precios de los insumos se vio obligada a culminarlo. En vista de que la situación económica de su hogar estaba bastante crítica, ella decidió iniciar nuevamente un negocio propio, una pequeña tienda donde comenzó a vender mecato, cigarrillos, gaseosas entre otros, con lo cual ha obtenido ingresos para aportar al sostenimiento de su hogar. María, en su constante lucha por salir adelante, siempre va en busca de oportunidades para seguir avanzando, por esa razón solicita su cuarto ciclo de crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en adecuaciones locativas y compra de surtido (productos lácteos, mecato, gaseosas, productos de la canasta familiar); de esta manera podrá ofrecer más variedad de productos a sus clientes y aumentará sus ingresos por ventas. Es así como María ve la oportunidad de seguir avanzando hacia el cumplimiento del sueño de tener su negocio bien surtido y posicionarlo en el sector donde reside, para así mejorar sus ingresos, continuar aportando a la economía de su hogar, brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos y tener una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, 46 years old, is married and a mother of 3 children. Previously she worked in agriculture. However, sales difficulties and the high price of supplies forced her out of that sector. As the financial situation at home became critical, she decided to go into business again, setting up a small shop selling snacks, cigarettes, soft drinks, etc. She uses the income she earns from the shop to support her family. 

In her constant effort to get ahead, María is always looking for further opportunities. For this reason, she is making a request for her fourth loan cycle. She will use the money to invest in improvements to her premises and to buy stock (dairy products, snacks, soft drinks and other household items). In this way, she can offer her customers a wider variety of products and so increase her sales income. 

María sees this as an opportunity to work towards achieving her dream, which is to have a well stocked business that has a good standing in the sector in the area where she lives. With this she can improve her income, continue contributing to the family finances and provide her children with a better education and quality of life.

loans.use: to carry out improvements to her premises and to buy stock (dairy products, snacks, soft drinks and other household items).

loans.name: Yèrèdèmè Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes du groupe Yèrèdèmè sont mariées  majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques avec en moyenne 39 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le quartier de Kanadjiguila en commune IV du District de Bamako  et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, elles ont fait recours à SORO YIRIWASO et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits de la friperie, du bois de chauffe, des chaussures plastiques, des pagnes wax, bazins, des brochettes de viande et du poisson fumé. 
Madame Kadiatou (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’habits de la friperie. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une Balle d’habits de la friperie à Bamako. La revente se fait généralement en ambulant au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Elle compte avoir un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 44 000fcfa qui sera utilisé pour réinvestir dans l’activité et assurer les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en: The six women of the Yèrèdèmè group are married, and mostly live in monogamous families, are 39 years old on average, and have 6 children. They all live in the Kanadjiquila quarter in the IV commune of the Bamako district, and met through neighbourly ties. In order to boost their working capital they are seeking help from Soro Yiriwaso, and are on the first cycle of a microloan. The group's members sell second-hand clothes, firewood, plastic shoes, wax pagnes (colourful cloths), bazins (fabric), meat kebabs and smoked fish. Madame Kadiatou (sitting on the far right of the photo) is a key seller of second-hand clothes. She aims to use her loan to purchase a load of second-hand clothes from Bamako. She typically sells her wares via door-to-door sales, for cash or credit, to a customer base primarily made up of women. She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 44,000 FCFA which will be reinvested into the business, and used to look after her children's health.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothes

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Hussain is an Iraqi youth client who is 19 years old and lives with his family composed of 5 members. Hussain, his father and his 2 brothers take part in the providing of the family's living.

Hussain owns a grocery store providing the needs of a house and sells dairy products, canned food, juices and detergents. After he gained some experience while working as an employee at a grocery store, in 2011 Hussain established his own business. Hussain gained good fame in the neighborhood thanks to his competitive prices.

Hussain is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to buy a motor generator. He believes that this loan will have a positive effect on the improvement of his business since it will store his dairy products fresh and refrigerated. Hussain is aiming to grow in this field so that he may provide himself a good and a stable career.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
This is Teodora, 59, a resident of Intramuros, Philippines. Her partner is Jose, a seaman, and they have children. She manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Teodora operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales, every day.

Teodora is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Teodora hopes that her business will continue to grow and expand. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ademar

texts.es: El Sr. Ademar tiene 37 años, tiene dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar,  va a utilizar  este préstamo para la siembra de arroz y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, el Sr. Ademar enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima ya que esta época es de mucho frio que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios para mejorara la calidad de vida del cliente y de su familia ya que el corre con todos los gastos del hogar, es una persona  responsable y trabajador se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindad, una vez que cosecha sus productos los comercializa en el mercado de la comunidad directamente del productor al consumidor.
texts.en:
Ademar, 37, has two school-age children. He needs this loan to buy supplies to prepare to plant rice on his land so that he can survive. Ademar's business faces challenging weather at this time of year because extreme cold can ruin the crops. 

He will use the profits to improve his and his family's standard of living, as he pays all the household expenses. He is responsible and hardworking. He thanks the institution for its support. He will sell his harvest directly to consumers in the local market.

loans.use: to prepare to plant rice on his land.

loans.name: Zaid

texts.en:
Zaid is a 21-year-old Iraqi youth client who is married. Zaid works to support his family while his wife takes care of the household. Zaid is a mechanic specializing in selling and repairing various car parts. He inherited this business from his father and gained all his experience from him. Zaid took over his father’s business in 2010 and since then has been growing his reputation and experience. 

Zaid is requesting a youth loan of 3,000 USD. The purpose of this loan is to buy a motor generator. Zaid plans to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may open a big garage one day and provide job opportunities to the unemployed youth of his neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy a generator.

loans.name: Together Group

texts.en: Mandela, who is in his mid 20s, is single. For two years, Mandela has had a retail shop selling different items like dry foods: sugar, salt, flour, airtime, soap, etc.. He works from 6:00am to 11:00pm daily and is able to make a fair return per month. This is Mandela's first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He plans to use the loan to replenish his shop's inventory. He dreams that one day he will be able to own a wholesale shop. He will share this loan with his loan group "Together" which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish inventory.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan, a 50 year old cacao farmer, lives in the beautiful village of San Antonio with his wife Stanislausa. They have nine children, all of whom still live at home. 

Juan began to plant cacao with assistance from a local association. He stated that the income he earns from the sale of cacao beans helps him pay to educate his children. He also says that cacao is a permanent crop, which requires less attention when it’s mature.

Juan is requesting this loan to hire workers to assist him in cleaning and preparing his land for transplanting 600 new seedlings. Juan presently has an outside employment with Cisco Construction, which gives him less time to properly focus on the farm. 

Juan’s future goal is to expand his cacao farm and quit other employment. The farm shall fully employ him and sustain his family’s needs. He hopes that his children achieve some level of education and have professional jobs or become cacao farmers.

loans.use: To prepare land for 600 new cacao seedlings

loans.name: Peña Blanca Group

texts.es: Doña Emilia es originaria de una población llamada Donaciano Ojeda, donde la mayoría de las personas todavía hablan su lengua materna que es el otomí, la principal fuente de empleo de esa localidad es la artesanía hecha en ocoshal materia prima que se saca de los pinos la cual recolectan para dar forma a hermosas creaciones como servilleteros, alhajeros, tortilleros, jarrones, fruteros y muchas artesanías mas, doña Emilia esta en un grupo de personas que piden crédito para mejorar sus negocios, su grupo se llama Peña Blanca, ella se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía y también tiene una huerta de duraznos y aguacates con el cual ya tiene 5 años trabajando muy duro, dice que ya ha tenido varias cosechas y que va y las vende a la central de abastos de Zitacuaro por cubetas ya que así le gana más, también vende los duraznos y ahorita está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de abonos orgánicos, insecticidas para mejorar sus árboles, dice que gracias a los créditos que le ha hecho la financiera ella ha mejorado su huerto ya que antes nada mas tenia los terrenos y no los trabajaba, gracias a que le dieron una capacitación de cómo mejorar su calidad de vida a través de los créditos ella empezó a trabajar sus terrenos y así poder mejorar sus ganancias. Ella tuvo 4 hijos pero nada mas dos viven con ella ya que los otros se casaron y ahorita van a la escuela en la primaria. Las demás integrantes del grupo se llaman Catalina, Gerarda y Elodia ellas invertirán sus negocios en la compra de artículos para surtir tienda de abarrotes, en la compra de insumos para mejorar sus huertas de aguacate y en la compra de material que ocuparan para hacer artesanía.
texts.en:
Emilia is from a town called Donanciano Ojeda where most of the residents still speak their native language, Otomí.  The main source of employment in this area is making crafts from ‘ocoshal,’ a raw material that comes from pine trees and that’s formed into beautiful creations like napkin holders, jewel boxes, tortilla baskets, jugs, fruit bowls and many other crafts.  

Emilia is in a group of people who are asking for a loan to improve their businesses.  The group is called “Peña Blanca” (White Cliff).  She works making crafts and also has a peach and avocado orchard that’s she’s been working hard at for five years already.  She says that she’s already had several harvests that she sells by the bucketful to the wholesale food market in Zitácuaro thus earning more.  She also sells the peaches and right now she’s asking for a loan to buy organic manure and insecticide to improve her trees.  She says that thanks to the loans she’s gotten from the loan company she’s been able to improve her orchard since she used to just own the land but didn’t grow anything on it.  Thanks to training they gave her on how to improve her quality of life by means of the loans she started to work her land and improve her profits.

She had four children but only two who are attending primary school still live with her; the others are married.  The other group members are Catalina, Gerarda and Elodia.  They will invest in their businesses.  They will buy stock merchandise for the grocery store, will buy supplies to improve the avocado orchard and will buy supplies needed to make crafts.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Teciana

texts.en:
Teciana is from the village of San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 58 years old. Teciana is married with children. Teciana grows rice to sell. 

In 2009, Teciana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Teciana is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and seedlings. A portion of this loan will be uses to cover the labor costs of planting and weeding.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings.

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
Asteria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Asteria requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fishing gear and other equipment. She has been in this business for 13 years.

In the future, Asteria would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Marcus

texts.en:
Marcus, age 63, is a certified organic cacao farmer. He lives in the beautiful village of Santa Cruz, Toledo District, Belize. Marcus and his wife, Concepcion, have eight grown children. Concepcion spends most of her time doing embroidery and house work.  Since there are no more children at home to attend to, she goes out and assists in harvesting ripe cacao pods at the farm.

Marcus got inspired to plant cacao with the assistance given by a local association. He stated that fermentation/drying has been a challenge for him and is happy that MMC cacao buying team is in place to purchase freshly harvested cacao beans. Marcus cultivates a variety of crops, which leaves him little time for cleaning his cacao farm. 

Marcus is requesting this loan to hire helpers to assist him in cleaning. Marcus stated that he is the only one taking care of the farm now, but he hopes that one of his children adopts the cacao-farming attitude, and then he will expand his farm with more cacao seedlings.

loans.use: To clean 500 mature cacao trees

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro, age 33, is a certified organic cacao farmer with MMC. He lives in the beautiful village of San Jose, where there is no access to electricity. Pedro and his wife, Alberta, have five children - all of whom are still living at home. Alberta enjoys her time at home attending to her children, which gives her less time to help on the farm.

Pedro started planting cacao with the assistance given by a local association. He stated that fermentation/drying has been a challenge. Selling cacao beans is sustaining his family needs. His major challenge for now is the fast growing weeds due to the increased rain fall for this part of the year. Pedro cultivates a variety of cash crops.

Pedro is requesting this loan to hire people to assist him in cleaning his land in preparation for 500 new cacao seedlings.

Pedro’s future goals include the expansion of his cacao farm so that he can live there, assist his children to receive some level of education and if they are interested, train them to become professional cacao farmers.

loans.use: To clean his land in preparation for 500 new cacao seedlings

loans.name: Elias

texts.es: Elías, tiene 53 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en una aldea de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. El tiene una pulpería desde hace 6 años donde vende productos alimenticios como granos básicos, harina, manteca, huevos, lácteos, azúcar, jabón, café, sal, refrescos, churros etc. Don Elías anteriormente se dedicaba a la albañilería y construcción, pero decidió por tener un ingreso fijo y pudo establecer su pulpería. Ha solicitado a ODEF un préstamo por 20,000 lempiras para surtir su negocio de productos alimenticios como granos básicos, refrescos, pastas, manteca, y otros. Su plan es tener bonito el negocio, mejorar su casa y darles el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elías, 53, is married and has three children, who live with him in Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. For six years, he has operated a grocery shop, where he sells household items such as grains, flour, margarine, eggs, milk products, sugar, soap, coffee, salt, beverages, and churros. Elías previously was a bricklayer and construction worker, but he decided he could open a store and have a fixed income. 

He has applied to ODEF for a loan of 20,000 lempiras to stock his business with food products such basic grains, beverages, pasta, margarine, and more. He plans to have a strong business, to renovate his house, and to educate his children.

loans.use: to stock his business with food products such basic grains, beverages, pasta, margarine, and more.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en:
Hilario, age 58, is a certified organic cacao farmer of MMC. The farmer lives in the beautiful village of Santa Cruz in the southern most part of Belize. Hilario together with this wife, Maura, raised twelve children with four still living at home.  Maura spends most of her days doing crafts and on weekend she assists her husband on the farm.

Hilario was inspired to plant cacao with the assistance given by a local association.  Hilario cultivates different farm crops such as corn, beans, etc. He states that his farms need to be clean every other week due to the rain. The rainy season in southern Belize affects the farmers by requiring more farm management. 

Hilario is requesting this loan to hire people to assist him in cleaning the area around his mature cacao trees. 

Hilario’s future goal is to expand his cacao farms so as to increase production yields and increase the family income. His goal is to educate his last four children in order for them to have some sort of employment or become a farmer.

loans.use: To clean his 475 mature cacao trees

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara lives with her husband in Vanadzor which is in the Lory region. They have a son who is already married and lives in the Russian Federation with his family. Tamara has graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute in the Department of Primary Pedagogy. She works at the local school as a primary school teacher. She also tutors students in Armenian language and literature for entrance examinations. Tamar loves her work very much and says that children always make her feel young and cheerful despite their occasional prankish behavior.

Tamara is asking for a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams to buy a computer. She is sure that having a computer at home will enable her to work easily and more productively.

loans.use: to buy a computer and other productivity tools.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is from Inasagan, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 37 years old, married, and has five children. To make a living, Nida raises pigs for sale. Nida has  been in her business for years and she earns PHP 2,000 a month from these activities. 

Nida joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2007. She is requesting a new loan of PHP 3,000 which will be used to purchase breeding livestock and feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock and feed.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is married and a mother of four children. She is 42 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Her husband is a farmer and she has helped plant and harvest bananas to earn a living. She sells bananas in the local market at retail, and she also sells in bulk to local traders. She has been doing this business for years. She earns 4,000 PHP a month from this work.

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase banana tissue culture seedlings.

Regina has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Regina hopes to have a banana fruit exportation business and gain more profit.

loans.use: to purchase banana tissue culture seedlings

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is 38 years old and married with three children. Her husband is a farmer whom she helps. They plant and harvest assorted flowers for sale. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase additional seeds and seedlings. Susan hopes to double her profit to have better living conditions in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds & seedlings.

loans.name: Norafil

texts.en:
Norafil is very thankful for her loan. It has helped her business which has continued to flourish. Her income from the loan went towards her her children's school expenses and their everyday expenses. To support their family, she and her husband are both working hard.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients, like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables to use in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Norafil dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories about her life and business and to study the Word of God for strength and inspiration.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with one child who is four months old. She owns a house that has no electricity or piped water.

She has operated a kiosk business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. 

With the loan of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, cooking oil, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, cooking oil, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a conservative woman, so she let her father take her place in the picture. She was born in 1994. She has 2 brothers and 1 sister.

Amani's father has been working in selling plastic products for 10 years. He started his project when he was watching his neighbors selling plastic products and he took the idea from them.

Amani's father is planning to expand his project and open his own store to sell the products he makes. Now Amani is seeking a youth loan to help her father buy new plastic products in order to increase his selling and raise his income.

loans.use: to help her father buy new plastic products to trade them

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca, tiene 41 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el Municipio de San Pedro Sula. Ella lleva dos años dedicándose a la venta de mercadería en su casa y de manera ambulante y por encargos. Ofrece productos como cremas, jabones, pastas dentales, champú, zapatos, ropa de niños etc. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 6,000 lempiras para comprar producto y surtir su inventario. Comprara ropa, cremas, champú y achinerías. Su plan es hacer crecer su negocio para ayudar con los gastos del hogar y tener mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en: Blanca, 41, is married, has three children, and lives in the city of San Pedro Sula. She has been selling merchandise from her house, as a street vendor, and by order for two years. She offers products such as lotions, soaps, toothpaste, shampoo, shoes, and children's clothing. She has applied for a loan of 6,000 lempiras to buy inventory: clothing, lotions, shampoo, and accessories. She plans to grow her business to pay household expenses and raise her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy inventory: clothing, lotions, shampoo, and accessories.

loans.name: Juan Andres

texts.es: Juan un joven, habitante de un barrio marginal de Managua llamado 31 de Diciembre  soltero y sin hijos, de profesión abogado busca la manera de superarse y vivir en mejores condiciones junto a su familia. Solicita el crédito para continuar reparando la parte trasera del techo de la vivienda y de un cuarto también. Comprara materiales como laminas de zinc, perlines y la mano de obra para terminar de una vez esta mejora, que solo gracias al apoyo de crédito podrá finalizar, ya que sus ingresos son muy bajos para cubrir estos gastos.
texts.en:
Juan is a young man living in one of Managua’s marginal neighborhoods called 31 de Diciembre; he’s single and has no children.  He’s an attorney by profession and seeks ways to improve himself and to live under better conditions with his family.

He requests the loan to continue repairing the rear of his roof at home and also one of the bedrooms.  He will buy supplies like metal sheeting, roofing purlins and pay labor costs to once and for all finish this improvement which he’s been able to do only thanks to support from the loan because his income is too low to cover these costs.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is 63 years old and lives with her two daughters in Yerevan. Karine is educated with an accounting degree. She works in her specialty simultaneously at three very big companies and gets very tired, but she has no other way of earning money. After three years of marriage she became a widow and since then has worked night and day to provide for her two daughters. 

In addition she must take special care of her younger daughter, who has some visual problems. Karine must spend most of her income on her daughter’s medical examinations and medicine. Her elder daughter also works. She has an advanced degree and works at the Ministry of Finance. 

Karine asks a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to pay for part of the expense of her elder daughter's wedding.

loans.use: to do pay some expenses for her elder daughter's wedding.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen lives in Vanadzor with his wife and two school-age children. He has been an electrician for four years. As the only breadwinner of the family, Armen works hard to earn a good income and sustain his family. Due to his hard work over the years, Armen is now providing high quality work and is able to expand his business. 

Armen has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up loans on soft conditions to people who do not have access to credit products. Armen needs this loan to purchase supplies for his business. It is very important for him to be able to satisfy his customers' needs and provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita, de 48 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su hija Melisa en la casa de su hermano. Margarita se dedica a la agricultura por eso siembra diversos productos agrícolas como papa, maíz y alfalfa que aparte de ayudarle en la alimentación de los animales que cuida lo utiliza para poder comercializar a los demás ganaderos de su zona. Cuenta que a pesar de dedicarse a la agricultura su principal ingreso económico lo tiene gracias a la ganadería con la crianza de cerdos, ovejas, cuyes y gallinas de calidad los cuales cuida con mucha dedicación y cada semana los comercializa en la feria de la ciudad o a los carniceros que llegan a su casa. Ahora desea incrementar el número de ganado para mejorar sus ingresos.
Este es su primer crédito con kiva y se siente agradecida por recibir una apoyo financiero que le permite seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Margarita, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Margarita, 48, is an unassuming woman.  She lives with her daughter, Melisa, in her brother’s house.  Margarita works in agriculture growing various agricultural products like potatoes, corn and alfalfa that in addition to help her feed the animals she raises she also sells to various other cattlemen in her zone.

She relates that despite working in agriculture her main source of income is thanks to animal husbandry.  She raises quality pigs, sheep, guinea pigs and chickens that she cares for with much dedication and sells them weekly in the city street market or to butchers that come by her house.  Now, she wants to increase her livestock to improve her income.

This is her first Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she gets that will make it possible for her to continue forward.  She commits to make her payments punctually.  Margarita will use the 500 soles to buy organic manure.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Sopio

texts.en:
Sopio is 27 years old and is living in the Tkibuli district with her husband and two sons (3 and 4 years old). Sopio is involved in an agricultural business and breeds a calf and a pig. Besides this, the family owns a vineyard and a small plot of land where different kinds of vegetables are grown. The harvest is used for feeding family.

Sopio’s husband is a miner and gets a small monthly income.  As their existing income is very small and is not enough to cover everyday expenses, Sopio decided to start up a clothing sales business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Sopio’s credit requests were rejected several times as she didn’t satisfy their requirements.

She received this credit in the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, the so-called Startup Program that gives vulnerable poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With this loan of 600 GEL, she will purchase clothing at wholesale prices in Turkey and sell it in her community door-to-door. Her regular customers will be her friends and neighbors. She plans to sell a wide assortment of well-priced clothing for men, women and children.

It is obvious that the job is hard for Sopio, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her business gradually. The Startup credit will be a great support for the family as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Glaiza

texts.en:
Glaiza is 25 years old, married and has one kid who is in school.

Glaiza is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Glaiza requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Glaiza has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Glaiza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa de 46 años de edad  tiene ya más de diez años dedicándose a la  Venta  de Cosméticos, este negocio es la fuente de ingreso para ella  y su familia,  está  solicitando un préstamo para  poder invertir en el negocio ya que le está  haciendo falta más variedad de  cosméticos.  Pero por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para llevar a cabo la  inversión,  es por eso que esta solicitando  el crédito. y así podrá  dar un mejor servicio a su clientes.  Planea pagar el préstamo con una parte de las ganancias del negocio. Ella  agradece el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Rosa is 46 years old. She has been selling cosmetics for more than 10 years. This business is her and her family’s source of income. Rosa is requesting this loan to invest in her business, as it is lacking a wider variety of cosmetics. At the moment, she doesn’t have the money needed to make the investment and that is why she is requesting a loan. That way, she will be able to provide better service to her customers. She plans to repay the loan with a portion of the profits from her business. She is grateful for the provided support.

loans.use: to stock cosmetics such as face powder, blush, make-up remover, concealer, and more.

loans.name: Centro De Riyos Group

texts.es: El grupo “Centro de Rioyos” está conformado por cuatro integrantes todos muy responsables son tres hombres y una mujer pertenecen a una comunidad mazahua ellos mismos eligieron el nombre de grupo porque asi se llama su comunidad Rioyos y viven en el centro de dicha comunidad, esta se encuentra dividida en varios barrios, algunas personas aun conservan su lengua mazahua, ciertas mujeres aun visten su traje típico mazahua muy coloridos collares que aun hacen mas hermoso su vestimenta. Las fietas mas conmemorada es la de San Pedro quien es el patrono de la comunidad de Rioyos. Don Ángel quien es miembro del grupo tiene 66 años de edad esta casado con la señora Crecencia desde hace ya varios años juntos formaron una familia con siete hijos de los cuales ya ninguno depende de dicha pareja. Don Ángel tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes desde hace 18 años cuenta que inicio su negocio porque su papá anteriormente también tenía una tienda de abarrotes Don Ángel comenta “Yo veía las buenas ganancias gracias al negocio de la tienda fue como quise iniciar mi propia tienda de abarrotes” Don Ángel es un hombre mayor difícilmente le darán un trabajo pero con su tienda de abarrotes puede solventar muy bien sus gastos. Esta Vez Don Ángel está solicitando un crédito para comprar productos de abarrotes como pan, huevo, leche, azúcar, sal, detergentes, etc. La tienda de Don Ángel lleva por nombre “La Mesa del Rincón” porque en la tienda siempre había una pequeña mesa de madera y siempre permaneció en el mismo lugar en el rincón. En el negocio de Don Ángel no tiene ninguna dificultad solo la competencia que tiene, sin embargo El tiene muchos amigos siempre ha considerado a sus clientes sus amigos por la competencia no se preocupa, “ Mi única meta es ver mi tiendita prosperar, no me gustaría cerrarla” comento el señor Ángel, El resto de los integrantes esta muy agradecido al igual que Don Angel por el préstamo para ellos será de gran ayuda asi podrán invertir en su negocios y verlos prosperar poco a poco. Jorge invertirá en su herrería, Doña Agustina y Don Zeferino invertirán en su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Centro de Rioyos” comprises four responsible members, four men and a woman. They live in a Mazahua community and selected the group's name because the area where they live is called Rioyos. It has several neighborhoods. Some residents still speak the Mazahua language, and some women still wear the traditional, colorful Mazahua necklaces that make their garments so beautiful. The most notable festival honors St. Peter, the patron saint of Rioyos. 

Ángel, 66, belongs to the group and has been married to Crecencia for many years. They have seven independent children. For 18 years, Ángel has owned a small grocery shop, a business he started because his father also owned a store. Ángel says that the income his father earned inspired him to open his own grocery store. As Ángel is older, he would have a hard time finding a job, but the store allows him to pay expenses. 

Ángel has applied for a loan to buy items like bread, eggs, milk, sugar, salt, and detergent. Ángel calls his store “La Mesa del Rincón” (Corner Table) because there has always been a wooden table in the same spot in the corner of his store. The only business problem Ángel faces is competition. However, he has many friends who are regular customers, so he doesn't worry much about competition. He says, "My only goal is seeing the store prosper, as I would not want to close it."

The other members are also grateful for the loan, which will help them invest in their businesses and slowly see them prosper. Jorge will invest in his smithy. Agustina and Zeferino will invest in their grocery stores.

loans.use: to buy household items such as milk, soap, and beverages.

location.town: Rioyos Buenavista, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a home solar energy system.

loans.name: Mila

texts.es:
Mila, de 33 años es una mujer amable. Vive junto a sy esposo Etson y sus dos hijos en la casa de su mama. Mila se dedica a la agricultura y su esposo trabaja como chofer trasladando alimentos en todas las ciudades del país. Su trabajo es muy sacrificado, por eso solo la visita durante un par de días. Pero hace algunos meses planeó con su mamá abrir un taller de soldadura, donde su esposo podrá trabajar y de esa manera estará más cerca de su familia. Mientras ella siembra papa, maíz y habas, en terrenos propios y alquilados, los que en cada cosecha comercializa en la ciudad más cercana. Tiene 12 años de experiencia en el campo y también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como gallinas, cerdos, cuyes y vacas, los que engorda para luego vender a un precio mayor. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida de recibir un apoyo financiero que le permita seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Mila, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Mila is 33 years old. She is a friendly woman. She lives with her husband Etson and their two children in her mother's house. Mila works in agriculture and her husband works as a driver transporting food from all the cities in the country. His job is very difficult, and so he only visits her for a couple of days. However, a few months ago, she started planning with her mother to open a welding shop where her husband can work and that way he will be closer to his family. Meanwhile, she grows potatoes, corn and beans on her own land and on land she rents. She sells every harvest in the closes town. She has 12 years' experience in the fields and she also raises small animals such as chickens, pigs, guinea pigs and cows. She fattens them up and sells them later at a better price. This is her second loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support that will allow her to keep going forward. She is also committed to making her payments on time.

Mila will invest the S/.1000 soles in buying organic fertilizer to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
This is Lorna, 37, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She’s married to Ruel, her business partner, and she is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household, while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 
 
Lorna is a corn dealer. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by sacks or by kilo. She and her husband deliver the corn to different markets and stores. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales, every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Lorna is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more corn for her business.

Lorna dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her children will finish their studies. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more corn, needed in her business.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is a single man who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. He has operated a dairy farming business for the last three years and his greatest challenge is seasonality.

With the KES 50,000,he wants to purchase another dairy cow for his farm. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase another dairy cow for his farm

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is married with four children. She is 42 years old and lives in Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Josefina owns and operates a plot of farmland, cultivating and harvesting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for years and earns PHP 5,000 each month.

She requested a new loan to cover replanting labor costs.

In the future, Josefina's plan is to save her returns in order to finance the studies of her children.

loans.use: to cover replanting labor costs

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano para damas y caballeros desde hace 10 años y cuenta con muchos clientes fijos con lo que puede mantener su negocio a flote, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logar cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar ,ella vive con su familia y su hijo de 3 años de edad, la clienta solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de ropa ya que posee gran demanda por parte de muchas personas, con lo que podrá adquirir en diferentes precios, estilos y colores y de esta forma contar con más clientes y así mejorar su calidad de vida  y la de su hijo.
texts.en:
The client has been selling second hand clothes for women and men for ten years.  She has a lot of fixed customers with whom she is able to keep her business afloat.  With the earnings that she gets from her sales, she manages to cover some of the household expenses.  She lives with her family and her three year old child.

The client is requesting a loan to be able to buy a greater quantity of clothes.  This is because she has a big demand from a lot of people.  She will be able to get different prices, styles, and colors.  This way she will have more customers, and she will improve her quality of life and that of her son.

loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, pants, and dresses, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Kazo Women's Group

texts.en:
Kazo Womens’ Group is located in the middle of Kazo Town some kilometers away from Ibanda. The group is comprised of mainly women who range in several categories of married, divorced and single mothers.

Miria is a single mother who divorced her husband in 2011 after her husband married a second wife. She has five children and two dependents from her sister who failed to look after them. She runs a small retail shop with capital of UGX 200,000 which she supplements with goat trade. She does all this single handedly. She intends to use the loan money to construct an improved shelter for her goats to protect them from harsh weather conditions and wild animals which attack them at night. She will use the rest of the money to add stock in her retail shop and the balance to pay school fees for her children. 

Her main challenge is harsh weather conditions and wild animals which attack her goats after she has injected loan money, which affects her cash flow. Despite all the challenges, Miria is a very hardworking and determined woman willing to take her children to good schools and provide all their basic needs.

The lady seated in front from the left is just saving but has not acquired a loan, she intends to take it in the next cycle when her business stabilizes. She signed the waiver form though.

loans.use: To construct a goat shelter

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a pottery business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 26000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy raw materials for her pottery business.

Elvira has been in this business for 10 years. Elvira earns more income from fish vending and a general store.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her pottery.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is married, with four children who go to school. They live in their own house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. 

Neema has operated a kiosk business for the past one year. She faces major challenges of competition from other food stall operators and transportation. 

With a KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sugar, wheat, and maize flour. She dreams of expanding to her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, wheat, and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 27 años, está casada con Juan y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia construida a base de madera. Yolanda se dedica a la agricultura por está razón cultiva cacao orgánico el cual es uno de los productos más rentables de su zona, se inició en está actividad hace 10 años. Tiene la suerte de contar con terrenos muy productivos los cuales le generan muy buenos productos.
Planea dividir sus parcelas en dos sectores una de las cuales será de cacao orgánico y el otro sector sera de cafe orgánico para el cual desea adquirir semillas de cafe y abono orgánico. Tiene planeado seguir trabajando con la misma motivación de siempre ya que su objetivo es incrementar aun más la dimensión de sus parcelas con la compra de otros terrenos que sus vecinos planean vender en el futuro. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles comprará abono orgánico y semillas de café.
texts.en:
Yolanda, age 27, is married to Juan and has two children.  They live together in their own house made of wood.  Yolanda is a farmer, and she grows organic cacao, which is one of the most profitable products in her area.  She started this business activity ten years ago.  She is lucky to have very productive land, which generates very good products.

She plans to divide her parcels of land into two sectors.  One of them will be for organic cacao, and the other sector will be for organic coffee.  In order to do so, she wishes to get coffee seeds and organic fertilizer.  She plans to continue working with the same motivation as always.  This is because her objective is to increase the size of her parcels even more by purchasing other land that her neighbors plan to sell in the future.

This is her first loan with Kiva.  She is grateful for the financial support she is receiving in order to get ahead.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.  She will use the 1,000 soles to buy organic fertilizer and coffee seeds.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and coffee seeds.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is 61 years old, married with five children and operates a transportation services business. Rogelio has been in this business for years and earns 5000 PHP a month. He lives in Mialen Clarin, Misamis Occidental.

In 2006, Rogelio joined GDMPC. He is requesting a new loan which he will use to purchase a new set of tires. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new set of tires

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, de 30 años, vive en compañía de sus 3 hijos a los que cuida y educa en su casa propia. Como toda mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, se dedica a la agricultura, posee extensas terrenos agrícolas en la zona alta de su localidad, ahí siembra plátano de la variedad isla y café, comenta que desde años se dedicó con mayor esfuerzo al café, pero la plaga de este año le impidió tener las ganancias que esperaba, es por esa razón que sembró más plátanos de la isla, “el precio en el mercado subió mucho y estoy obteniendo buenas ganancias, ahora tengo que abonarlo muy bien”, comenta. La cosecha lo realiza cada 15 días y necesita abonarlo para que produzca un buen fruto.  Este es su primer préstamo con KIVA y se siente agradecida de recibir un apoyo financiero que le permite seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Victoria, invertirá los S/.2500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Victoria, who is 30-years old, lives together with her three children, who she cares for and educates, in her home.  Like all hard-working and enterprising women, she makes her living in agriculture.  She has extensive cropland in the area high above her neighborhood.  She plants on it bananas of the island variety and coffee.  Victoria says that for years she has been putting greater energy into her coffee plants, but that this year's infestation prevented her from getting the profit she'd hoped for.  That is why she planted more island bananas this year.  She says, “the market price (for bananas) went up a lot and I'm earning a good profit.  Now I need to fertilize them well."  Victoria harvests every two weeks and she needs to fertilize her plants so they produce good quality fruit.  This is Victoria's first loan with KIVA, and she feels very grateful for having received the financial help that allows her to keep moving forward.  In addition, she promises to punctually comply with her repayment plan.  Victoria will invest the S/.2500 soles ($900 USD) in the purchase of organic compost to nourish her sown fields.

loans.use: to purchase organic compost.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 40 years old, married, and has two children. She is from Guba, Clarin. To make a living, Vivian grows bananas to sell, which she has been doing for more than six years, earning 4,500 PHP a month. Her husband is earning from his service-based business providing motorcycle transportation in the locality.

Vivian joined GDMPC in 2012. She is requesting a loan which she will use to cover the costs of banana replanting . 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her farm to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to cover the costs of banana replanting

loans.name: David Jese

texts.es:
David, vive con su familia, formada por su esposa y sus dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 3 y 4 años, no tiene familiares en el extranjero. El, se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz, lo realiza todos los días y la ventaja que posee que el terreno está a 200 metros del lugar donde reside, la dificultad con la que se podría enfrentar es el cambio climático. 
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas, tales como: semilla, abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a salir adelante con la cosecha, ya que por el momento el tiempo climático está bien para el cultivo.
Su sueño es construir una vivienda digna de vivir para su familia
texts.en:
David lives with his family, which is comprised of his wife and two children.  The children are three and four years old.  He does not have relatives abroad.

He is a farmer, and he grows corn.  He does this every day.  The advantage that he has is that the land is 200 meters from where he lives.  The difficulty that he could face is the change in the weather.

The loan that he is requesting will allow him to buy agricultural supplies like seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, and pesticides, among others.  This investment will help him to get ahead with the harvest.  At this time the climate is good for cultivation.

His dream is to build a decent house for his family to live in.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, and pesticides, among others.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is from Vanadzor town and lives with his sister. Their parents live and work abroad to help support their children financially. 
Ashot is involved in providing tourism services for local customers. Ashot has agreements with four hotels in neighboring countries and is providing different options for locals to spend their vacations outside Armenia. To develop his start-up business, Ashot has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because his business isn't registered as a formal business. Ashot has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan is very important for Ashot to purchase needed supplies for his work, which will make his business run easier and faster.

loans.use: to pay for equipment needed for his business

loans.name: Daed

texts.en: Daed is 20 years old and lives in Mafraq, Jordan with her husband, who is in the military. They have no children yet. Daed is currently in her first year studying for a bachelor's degree in math. She is planning to expand her studies in the future for a master's degree. But as she is facing a financial crisis, she is asking for a loan to pay for her education fees.

loans.use: To pay for her education fees

loans.name: Elida

texts.en:
Elida is an Egyptian Albanian, who lives in the vicinity of a metallurgical complex. She is requesting a loan to pay for scrap.

Elida is 38 and has three children who, unfortunately, don’t go to school, due to the extreme poverty level that has been a part of their lives forever, as per Elida’s saying. “With my kids, we’ve been collecting scrap and selling it to earn an income. The money we make is not huge, but is something to help us pay for some very basic food. The conditions we live in are very unhealthy too,“ she said, showing to the loan officer the place of their living, as seen in the background of the photograph.

Collecting scrap is one of the main odd-jobs here in Albania for some members of the Roma and Egyptian vulnerable communities. Traveling to cities, someone would notice members of these communities, including children, digging in the cities’ large garbage bins for scrap, whether plastic or metal.

loans.use: to buy scrap to sell it to the metallurgical complex, located in the vicinity of her home.

loans.name: Marie Kris

texts.en: Marie Kris is an education student in Western Mindanao State University. She is from Inroad, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Her father is a farmer while her mother is a businesswoman. They have been doing this to earn a living. Marie Kris helps her parents during vacations and on weekends. She borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC to cover the costs of her school tuition fee. She is hopeful to finish her studies and able to help her parents to augment their living and to have a better future too.

loans.use: to cover the costs of school tuition fee
